Description: THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY (BMIC OR TRIBE) IS INTERESTED IN PERFORMING A FEASIBILITY STUDY TO ASSESS BROADBAND (THE PROJECT) WITHIN THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY.  A PROJECT OF THIS TYPE HAS NOT BEEN COMPLETED IN THE PAST BY BMIC.  A TEAM OF KEY STAFF FROM BMIC WILL SEEK AND USE CONSULTANTS TO DETERMINE WHAT IS ALREADY IN PLACE FOR CURRENT SERVICES.  A CONSULTANT WILL DO AN ASSESSMENT, FOLLOWED BY TECHNICAL ANALYSES, TO DELVE INTO THE COMMUNITYS BROADBAND NEEDS, SERVICES, AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  A FINAL REPORT OF THE ASSESSMENT MAY CONTAIN A ROADMAP FOR THE EXECUTION AND ASSIST IN POSITIONING BMIC TO PURSUE FURTHER FUNDING FOR BROADBAND.

THE TWENTY-NINE PALMS BAND OF MISSION INDIANS RESPECTFULLY REQUEST  175,000 IN FY22 NATIONAL TRIBAL BROADBAND GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING FOR ITS BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE STUDY FOR SOUTHERN RESERVATION PROJECT. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE TRIBES SOUTHERN RESERVATION LOCATED NEAR COACHELLA, RIVERSIDE COUNTY, CA.

THE ALABAMA-COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS (ACTT) PROPOSES THE FEASIBILITY AND PLANNING FOR BROADBAND CONNECTIVITY FOR THE ALABAMA-COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS (ACTT) PROJECT AS A BROADBAND ASSESSMENT, FEASIBILITY, AND PLANNING PROJECT TO FOCUS AND PRIORITIZE DEVELOPMENT OF BROADBAND CONNECTIVITY FOR THE DISTINCT PURPOSE OF ENHANCING THE OVERALL ECONOMIC RESILIENCE OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY IN POLK COUNTY, TEXAS. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THREE DISTINCT PHASES, EACH WITH A DISTINGUISHABLE OBJECTIVE AND DELIVERABLE, A BROADBAND ASSESSMENT, FEASIBILITY STUDY AND DEPLOYMENT IMPLEMENTATION PLAN. THE COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH WILL EXPLORE THE ASSETS AND OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE AND CULMINATE IN A PLAN TO IMPLEMENT THE MOST FEASIBLE STRATEGIES IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE EXPLORATION PROCESS. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS THE TRIBES EFFORTS TO BECOME A CONNECTED COMMUNITY WHILE SUSTAINING THE CULTURE AND HERITAGE OF THE PEOPLE OF THE ALABAMA-COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS.

THIS PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE RISKS, REWARDS, AND ROADMAP FOR THE CREATION OF A TELECOMMUNICATIONS ENTERPRISE TO SERVE THE LOWER BRULE RESERVATION OF SOUTH DAKOTA. THE OUTCOMES WILL EMPOWER THE TRIBE WITH THE INFORMATION REQUIRED TO ADEQUATELY ADDRESS THE CONSIDERATIONS OF FINANCIAL AND PRACTICAL RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH DEVELOPING A BROADBAND NETWORK PROPOSED TO BE WITHIN THE TWO COMMUNITIES OF LOWER BRULE AND WEST LOWER BRULE AND THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION AREA, POPULATION 698 (SEE MAP).THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DETERMINE IF THE LOWER BRULE SIOUX TRIBE SHOULD BUILD A REGULATED TELECOMMUNICATIONS OPERATION OR A LESSER REGULATED ENTITY TO PROVIDE BROADBAND SERVICE TO THE LOWER BRULE SIOUX RESERVATION OF SOUTH DAKOTA. PRODUCTS OR OBJECTIVES TO REACH THE STATED GOAL GENERATED BY THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE  10 TO11 OBJECTIVES WILL BE STUDIED RANGING FROM COMPREHENSIVE MAPPING OF TELECOM ASSETS IN AND SURROUNDING THE LOWER BRULE SIOUX RESERVATION, A SCENARIO BASED FINANCIAL MODEL, OPPORTUNITIES ANALYSIS, BUSINESS STRUCTURE EVALUATION, REGULATED ENTITY ROAD MAP, COMPANY CHARTER ROAD MAP, BUSINESS OPERATIONS SYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURE NEEDS FOR A TISP AND REQUIREMENTS FOR AN AFFORDABLE CONNECTIVITY PROGRAM (ACP).

THE PRAIRIE BAND POTAWATOMI NATION (PBPN OR THE NATION) IS PURSUING A NATIONAL TRIBAL BROADBAND GRANT (NTBG) IN THE AMOUNT OF  107,520 TO ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF FIBER BROADBAND ON THE NATIONS LAND IN RURAL NORTHEAST KANSAS. ALL RESIDENCES WITHIN THE PBPN 121.5 SQUARE MILE GEOGRAPHIC AREA LACK ACCESS TO RELIABLE BROADBAND SERVICE, AND MANY LACK ACCESS TO ANY BROADBAND PROVIDER AT ALL. EXISTING BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE ON THE NATION WAS BUILT PRIMARILY TO SERVE GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS AND IS IN A LIMITED SECTION OF THE RESERVATION. HOWEVER, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS BROUGHT TO THE FOREFRONT THE CRITICAL NEED FOR RELIABLE, QUALITY BROADBAND ACCESS TO EVERY HOME.  WHILE THE NATION HAS MADE GREAT STRIDES TO DEVELOP ITS FIBER INFRASTRUCTURE, IT IS STILL LACKING AN UNDERSTANDING OF MANY FINANCIAL COMPONENTS THAT WILL BE CRITICAL TO ENSURING ITS LONG-TERM SUCCESS, INCLUDING A FINANCIAL ANALYSIS, A COMPETITIVE AND NEEDS ANALYSIS, AND AN OPERATING PRO FORMA BUSINESS PLAN. THESE COMPONENTS ARE SOUGHT TO BE ADDRESSED THROUGH THIS PROJECT. IF AWARDED, THE NATION WOULD BE CLOSER THAN IT HAS EVER BEEN TO A STATE OF READINESS TO DEPLOY BROADBAND.

THE IOWA TRIBE OF KANSAS AND NEBRASKA (TRIBE) REQUIRES THIS GRANT BECAUSE THE TRIBE HAS AN OLD TRIBALLY OWNED FIBER NETWORK THAT WAS INSTALLED ON PART OF THE RESERVATION 10 YEARS AGO.  IT DOES NOT REACH ALL OF THE HOMES OR ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS, IS UNRELIABLE, AND NEEDS TO BE UPGRADED AND EXPANDED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESS.   THIS GRANT WILL FUND A STUDY AND CREATE A BROADBAND PLAN TO MEET THE DIGITAL ACCESS AND EQUITY NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY FOR HEALTHCARE, EDUCATION, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.

THE CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT   HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA (TLINGIT   HAIDA), A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WITH 34,000 TRIBAL CITIZENS, IS REQUESTING  174,500 FOR A BROADBAND FEASIBILITY STUDY THAT WILL PRODUCE MULTIPLE DESIGN CONCEPTS AT VARYING LOCATIONS IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA. THIS PROPOSED STUDY SPEAKS SQUARELY TO THE TRIBES MISSION TO PROVIDE HIGH-QUALITY MODERN INFRASTRUCTURE, INCLUDING BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE, AND IS CRITICAL TO PROMOTING THE ECONOMIC SOVEREIGNTY AND SUCCESS OF OUR CITIZENS. THE STUDY WILL FOCUS ON PRINCE OF WALES ISLAND, WHICH SITS 135 MILES BY 65 MILES, SLIGHTLY LARGER THAN THE STATE OF DELAWARE.

BROADBAND NETWORKS RANK AMONG THE MOST IMPORTANT INFRASTRUCTURE ASSETS OF OUR TIME  FOR PURPOSES OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMPETITIVENESS, INNOVATION, WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS, HEALTH CARE, EDUCATION, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY. ACCESS TO HIGH-SPEED INTERNET SERVICE HAS BECOME AN ESSENTIAL COMPONENT FOR THE ECONOMY, EDUCATION, AND HEALTHCARE WITHIN COMMUNITIES WORLDWIDE. HOWEVER, US FEDERAL DATA CONTINUES TO SHOW THAT TRIBAL LANDS ARE AMONG THE LEAST CONNECTED AREAS IN NORTH AMERICA. COMMUNITIES WITHOUT RELIABLE HIGH-SPEED INTERNET SERVICE CITE A GROWING GAP BETWEEN THE RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO THEIR RESIDENTS AND THOSE IN COMMUNITIES THAT HAVE ROBUST NETWORK ACCESS.THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIORS (DOI) OFFICE HAS IDENTIFIED THE NEED FOR FEASIBILITY STUDIES IN ORDER TO EXPLORE THE POSSIBILITY OF DEVELOPING OR EXTENDING BROADBAND SERVICES IN TRIBAL COMMUNITIES.  THE FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL ASSIST THE PALA BAND OF MISSION INDIANS WITH MAKING AN INFORMED DECISION REGARDING THE DEPLOYMENT AND EXPANSION OF BROADBAND WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.THE NATIONAL TRIBAL BROADBAND GRANT WILL SERVE APPROXIMATELY 1,250 ENROLLED TRIBAL MEMBERS OF THE PALA BAND OF MISSION INDIANS, A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE. THE PALA RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN THE RURAL PARTS OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, APPROXIMATELY 40 MILES NORTHEAST OF SAN DIEGO AND 30 MILES INLAND FROM THE PACIFIC OCEAN.THE PALA BAND OF MISSION INDIANS HAS BEEN INTERESTED IN ESTABLISHING BROADBAND SERVICES, TRANSMITTED THROUGH FIBER. HOWEVER, DUE TO PERSONNEL LIMITATIONS AND ECONOMIC HURDLES DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, BROADBAND HAS YET TO BE IMPLEMENTED. THIS IS WHY THE NATIONAL TRIBAL BROADBAND GRANT OPPORTUNITY IS THE PERFECT OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY THAT WILL GUIDE INSIGHTFUL PLANNING TOWARDS THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BROADBAND. THE FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL PROVIDE THE TRIBE WITH THE INFORMATION NEEDED FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT, EXPANSION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A SUSTAINABLE BROADBAND ACCESS SOLUTION TO IMPROVE BROADBAND ACCESS FOR EXISTING UNDERSERVED UNCONNECTED TRIBAL AREAS. THE STUDY WILL TAKE ACCOUNT OF KEY VARIABLES INCLUDING SPECTRUM, REGULATORY, POLICY, TECHNOLOGY, APPLICATIONS, USER DEMAND, COMPETITION, FINANCIAL MODELING, AND OTHER FACTORS TO DEVELOP A PLAN THAT WILL ENABLE HOLISTIC ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT - INCLUDING BROADBAND CONNECTIVITY.THE PALA BROADBAND PLANNING PROJECT GREATLY BENEFITS THE TRIBES ABILITY TO GROW AS A GOVERNMENT, INCLUDING THE 25 DEPARTMENTS AND 571 RESIDENTIAL HOMES. THROUGH HIRED CONSULTANTS, THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN ASSESSMENT OF THE TRIBES CURRENT BROADBAND SERVICES, ENGINEERING ASSESSMENTS AND AN ESTIMATE TO BUILD AND EXPAND A BROADBAND NETWORK THAT WILL MEET THE MINIMUM CONNECTIVITY REQUIREMENTS. AFTER THESE DELIVERABLES HAVE BEEN ACHIEVED, THE TRIBES EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND REMOTE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE ENHANCED, EMERGENCY AND LAW ENFORCEMENT NEEDS WILL BE MET, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR SELF-EMPLOYMENT WILL BE IMPROVED. THE FEASIBILITY AND ASSESSMENT SERVICES WILL HELP THE PALA BAND OF MISSION INDIANS MAKE DECISIONS REGARDING THE DEPLOYMENT OF BROADBAND IN OUR COMMUNITY, EMPHASIZING THAT THIS OPPORTUNITY WOULD CONTINUE TO SUPPORT OUR SOVEREIGNTY AS A NATION.

MIDDLETOWN RANCHERIA OF POMO INDIANS OF CALIFORNIAS  MIDDLETOWN RANCHERIA BROADBAND PARTNERSHIP AND ENGINEERING FEASIBILITY STUDY  AIMS TO DEVELOP MIDDLETOWNS OWN BROADBAND NETWORK UPON ITS TRIBAL LANDS. CURRENTLY, THE BROADBAND SERVICE THAT THE RANCHERIA RECEIVES IS UNRELIABLE BECAUSE THE SERVICE PROVIDER CANNOT OFFER THE CAPACITY THAT THE RANCHERIA NEEDS, AND THE SERVICES IT DOES PROVIDE ARE AT A HIGH RATE. THE FOCUS OF THIS NTBG STUDY, THEREFORE, WILL BE TO INVESTIGATE COSTS AND ENGINEERING REQUIREMENTS TO BRING BROADBAND BACKHAUL TO THE RANCHERIA VIA A MICROWAVE SHOT FROM WILLIAMS, CA.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW MIDDLETOWN TO EXPLORE THE FEASIBILITY OF MAINTAINING MOST OF THE CURRENT SERVICE BUT PROVIDING AUGMENTATION AND OR FAR TOLERANCE TO THE EXISTING PIPE AND CONNECTING MIDDLETOWN S FUTURE FIBER NETWORK TO INTERNET BACKHAUL PROVIDED BY A SECOND PROVIDER, WHICH IS LOCATED JUST OUTSIDE OF WILLIAMS. BRINGING BACKHAUL TO MIDDLETOWN WOULD AID THE RANCHERIA IN CREATING AND MAINTAINING ITS OWN INTERNET SERVICE RATHER THAN HAVING TO RELY ON THE OFTEN-SPOTTY SERVICE CURRENTLY PROVIDED. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE PROJECT WILL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: (1) ASSESS THE TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY OF PROVIDING AN ALTERNATE BROADBAND INTERNET PEERING OPTION TO THE RANCHERIA AND MIDDLETOWN COMMUNITY  (2) EXPLORE THE TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY OF BUILDING A PRIVATE TOWER ON MIDDLETOWNS TRIBAL LAND  (3) EVALUATE POTENTIAL THIRD-PARTY PARTNERSHIPS, PARTICULARLY FOR THE RANCHERIAS FUTURE ENGINEERING AND DEPLOYMENT NEEDS  (4) DETERMINE THE POSSIBILITY OF SELF-SERVICE BY INTEGRATING BROADBAND INTO TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION OR A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY  AND (5) EXPLORE WAYS TO ENHANCE OVERALL TRIBAL BROADBAND SERVICE BY EMPLOYING TECHNOLOGY THAT CAN UTILIZE THE EXISTING 2.4 GHZ BROADBAND SERVICE LICENSE THE TRIBE WAS RECENTLY ISSUED VIA AN APPLICATION FILING WITH THE FCC FOR THIS TRIBAL BROADBAND SPECTRUM OPPORTUNITY. THE CONSTRUCTION OF A TOWER ON THE TRIBAL FOOTPRINT WOULD ENHANCE THIS POSSIBILITY. BY IMPROVING BROADBAND ACCESS FOR ITS 201 TRIBAL MEMBERS AS WELL AS SURROUNDING POPULATIONS, MIDDLETOWN RANCHERIA WILL IMPROVE THE WELLBEING OF ITS RURAL COMMUNITY BY MAKING CRITICAL SERVICESSUCH AS TELEHEALTH, REMOTE WORK OPPORTUNITIES, AND ONLINE EDUCATIONAVAILABLE.

LUMMI INDIAN BUSINESS COUNCILS GOAL IS TO BRING ULTRA-FAST INTERNET AND COMMUNICATION TO THE LUMMI NATION. THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS SHOWN HOW ESSENTIAL BROADBAND SERVICES ARE, HOWEVER, THERE ARE MANY AREAS IN THE COMMUNITY WHERE BROADBAND SPEEDS ARE TOO SLOW AND SOME AREAS WHERE RESIDENTS DO NOT GET BROADBAND SERVICES. SO, THE DEVELOPMENT OF A LUMMI OWNED INTERNET SERVICE PROVIDER WILL HELP CLOSE THE DIGITAL DIVIDE BY BRINGING CRITICAL BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE LUMMI RESERVATION.

THE SAULT STE. MARIE TRIBE OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS (SAULT TRIBE) SEEKS FUNDING OF  162,318.06 FOR A TWO-YEAR PROGRAM TO DEVELOP A BROADBAND FEASIBILITY STUDY ACROSS THE SAULT TRIBES SEVEN-COUNTY SERVICE AREA IN THE EASTERN UPPER PENINSULA (UP) OF MICHIGAN. THE SAULT TRIBES SEVEN-COUNTY SERVICE AREA INCLUDES CHIPPEWA, MACKINAC, LUCE, ALGER, DELTA, MARQUETTE, AND SCHOOLCRAFT COUNTIES. COMBINED, THE SERVICE AREA SERVES APPROXIMATELY 180,000 PEOPLE, COVERS 8,573 SQUARE MILES OF LAND MASS, AND ANOTHER 10,488 SQUARE MILES OF WATER. EXCLUDING MARQUETTE COUNTY, WITH THE CITY OF MARQUETTE, THE POPULATION DENSITY IS FEWER THAN 18 PEOPLE PER SQUARE MILE.FOR THE SAULT TRIBE BROADBAND PLANNING GRANT (NTBG) PROJECT, SAULT TRIBE WILL CONTRACT WITH MAGELLAN, A BROADBAND DESIGN, ENGINEERING, AND CONSULTING FIRM THAT HAS BEEN COMPETITIVELY SELECTED TO CONSTRUCT THE FEASIBILITY STUDY. WHILE THE PROJECT WILL HAVE A TWO-YEAR PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, SAULT TRIBE WILL COMPLETE THE PROJECT WITHIN FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.THE FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SECTIONS:1. TECHNICAL OPTIONS  WITH LAND MASS COVERING LESS THAN 50  OF THE SEVEN-COUNTY TOPOGRAPHY, FIBER-TO-THE-HOME (FTTH) MAY NOT BE COST EFFECTIVE. THE ALTERNATIVES MAY INCLUDE FIBER BACKBONE, WIRELESS LAST-MILE SERVICES DELIVERED USING LICENSED AND UNLICENSED SPECTRUM FROM COMMUNICATIONS TOWERS. THE STUDY WILL ALSO CONSIDER LEASING OF FIBER FROM EXISTING PROVIDERS AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMERCIAL INTERNET SERVICE PROVIDERS (ISP) AND LOCAL UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES.2. COMPLETE CONSTRUCTION COST ALTERNATIVES  FOR THE IDENTIFIED SOLUTIONS, SAULT TRIBE WILL DEVELOP CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATING COST ESTIMATES FOR A BROADBAND NETWORK COVERING THE FOCUS AREAS IDENTIFIED AS CRUCIAL BY THE SAULT TRIBE AND DETERMINED AS MOST IN NEED.3. COMPLETE ASSESSMENT OF CURRENT SERVICES  THOSE PLANS AND SERVICES OFFERED BY COMMERCIAL INTERNET SERVICE PROVIDERS (ISP) ACROSS THE UP BY ZIP CODE.4. SURVEY DEVELOPMENT  SAULT TRIBE WILL DEVELOP A BROADBAND SURVEY, INCLUDING INTEGRATED SPEED TESTS AND OPINION QUESTIONS ON WHETHER AND HOW SAULT TRIBE SHOULD PARTICIPATE IN BROADBAND. SAULT TRIBE WILL ALSO LEVERAGE STATE OF MICHIGANS SURVEYS TO SUPPORT STATEWIDE MAPPING, IF APPROPRIATE.5. DEVELOPMENT OF SEVEN-COUNTY MAP  THIS MAP WILL INCLUDE ALL PREMISES AND SUPPORT PLANNING FOR LATER BEAD SUBGRANT APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT BY DENOTING PREMISES AS UNSERVED, UNDERSERVED, OR SERVED. SAULT TRIBE WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH MICHIGAN HIGH-SPEED INTERNET OFFICE (MIHI) TO COORDINATE SUBMISSION OF CHALLENGES TO FCCS ACCESS DATA.6. SUMMARY OF BROADBAND ALTERNATIVES  PREPARE AN ANALYSIS OF OPTIONS OF OWNERSHIP AND OPERATIONS ALTERNATIVES, INCLUDING PROS AND CONS OF EACH OPTION. SAULT TRIBES CONTRACTOR WILL RECOMMEND THE BEST OPTIONS FOR SAULT TRIBE.7. IDENTIFY BROADBAND ACCESS NEEDS  BASED ON TRIBAL NEEDS AND EXISTING SERVICES, ENUMERATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVED ACCESS TO ENABLE TELEWORK, TELEHEALTH, DISTANCE LEARNING, AND OTHER SERVICES.8. DEVELOP ISP SOLICITATIONS  INCLUDING PLANS FOR SAULT TRIBE MANAGING ISP OVER THE LONG TERM.9. DEVELOP FIBER CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE SOLICITATIONS  INCLUDING PLANS FOR (A) MANAGING THE NETWORK AND (B) MARKETING DARK FIBER.10. DEVELOP PARTNERSHIP STRATEGIES, DOCUMENTS  INCLUDING PLANS FOR ASSESSING PARTNERS, COORDINATING ACTIVITIES, AND PRODUCING DRAFT PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENTS.

THE MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION (MCN) IS THE FOURTH LARGEST FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE IN THE UNITED STATES WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 97,343 CITIZENS  MORE THAN HALF OF WHOM LIVE WITHIN THE TRIBAL RESERVATION. MCN TRIBAL HEADQUARTERS ARE CENTRALLY SITUATED WITHIN THE NATION S JURISDICTION IN THE CITY OF OKMULGEE. THE SERVICE AREA CONSISTS OF URBAN, RURAL, AND VERY RURAL-REMOTE AREAS. POPULATION DENSITIES VARY FROM SMALL UNINCORPORATED COMMUNITIES, WITH FEWER THAN 50 RESIDENTS, TO TULSA, ONE OF THE LARGEST URBAN AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA.      SPANNING NEARLY 5,000 SQUARE MILES, THE MCN RESERVATION INCLUDES ELEVEN COUNTIES IN EAST-CENTRAL OKLAHOMA, INCLUDING TWO DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONES. THE JURISDICTION IS DIVIDED INTO EIGHT DISTRICTS CORRESPONDING NAMELY WITH THE COUNTIES OF CREEK, MCINTOSH, MUSKOGEE, OKFUSKEE, OKMULGEE, AND PORTIONS OF WAGONER, TULSA, ROGERS, HUGHES, SEMINOLE, AND MAYES. THE NATION PROVIDES VITAL SERVICES SUCH AS HEALTH CARE, HOUSING, EDUCATION ASSISTANCE, SOCIAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, CULTURE AND LANGUAGE PRESERVATION, AND OTHER BASIC GOVERNMENT FUNCTIONS AND SERVICES.     MCN IS PLEASED TO SUBMIT THIS APPLICATION FOR THIS GRANT WHICH WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDING TO PERFORM AN ANALYSIS OF EXISTING BROADBAND PROVIDERS, COMPARE PROVIDER SERVICES AND COSTS, AND DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE STRATEGY FOR THE INTERCONNECTION POINTS IDENTIFIED IN BRISTOW, BEGGS, OKEMAH, CALVIN, DUSTIN, AND EUFAULA, ALL IN OKLAHOMA. NEUTRAL HOST CARRIERS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED IN EACH LOCATION AND FURTHER RESEARCH IS NEEDED TO UNCOVER THE SPECIFIC TECHNOLOGIES, EQUIPMENT, AND POLICIES FOR EACH INTERCONNECTION POINT AS IT RELATES TO THE LONG-TERM PLANNING THAT IS IN PROGRESS. INTERCONNECTION POINTS ARE CRUCIAL FOR THE SUCCESS, RESILIENCE, AND AFFORDABILITY OF FUTURE BROADBAND DEVELOPMENTS. AS PART OF THIS STUDY, THE MCN WILL ALSO CONDUCT AN INVENTORY OF ITS EXISTING RESOURCES (EQUIPMENT) AND SERVICE CONTRACTS AT EACH OF ITS GOVERNMENT FACILITIES AND THEIR RESPECTIVE INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (IT) DEPARTMENTS.      THE NATION IS REQUESTING  175,000 IN FEDERAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THIS PROJECT WHICH, IF REALIZED, WILL BE USED TO MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND PRESENTS AN OPPORTUNITY FOR MCN TO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE SUSTAINABILITY OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH TRIBAL BROADBAND EXPANSION. THIS PROJECT IS IN KEEPING WITH THE NATIONAL TRIBAL BROADBAND GRANT ELIGIBLE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE EXPANSION OF HIGH-SPEED INTERNET (BROADBAND) AND WILL NOT DUPLICATE PREVIOUS WORK.

THE NENANA BROADBAND PROJECT AWARD WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CREATION OF A THOROUGHFEASIBILITY STUDY TO ESTABLISH A COORDINATED AND STRATEGIC APPROACH TOWARDS A CONSTRUCTION READYDESIGN FOR THE RURAL, UNSERVED COMMUNITY OF NENANA, ALASKA. THE PROPOSED STUDY WILL ASSESSFEASIBILITY OF DEPLOYING A FIBER NETWORK IN THE VILLAGE AMONGST MANY EXISTING, POORLY DOCUMENTEDBURIED AND OVERHEAD UTILITIES. THE STUDY WILL CONSIDER THE FINANCIAL AND PRACTICAL RISKS ASSOCIATEDWITH DEVELOPING A BROADBAND NETWORK AND CONTEMPLATE FUTURE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCESTRUCTURES FOR NEW TRIBALLY OWNED INFRASTRUCTURE.AS OUTLINED IN THE NTBG FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NOTICE, THIS PROJECT ALIGNS WITH THE PURPOSEOF THE GRANT PROGRAM WITH THE OBJECTIVES TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE, SPUR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENTAND COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY, CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SELF- EMPLOYMENT, ENHANCE EDUCATIONALRESOURCES AND REMOTE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, AND MEET EMERGENCY AND LAW ENFORCEMENT NEEDS BYBRINGING BROADBAND SERVICES TO NENANA, ALASKA.UPON COMPLETION OF THE SCOPE OF WORK, NENANA NATIVE ASSOCIATION (THE FEDERALLYRECOGNIZED TRIBE), EMERGENCY SERVICES, SCHOOLS, AND COMMUNITY FRAMEWORK WILL BE CONNECTEDTO THE WORLD AND MORE EFFECTIVE, MAKING RESIDENTS SAFER, HEALTHIER, AND MORE ECONOMICALLYCOMPETITIVE. NENANA IS A RURAL COMMUNITY SERVING AS AN IN-BETWEEN ON THE GEORGE PARKSHIGHWAY FOR THE LARGER CITIES OF WASILLA AND FAIRBANKS. RELIABLE INTERNET IS CRITICAL TO NENANASRESIDENTS AND VISITORS. ALL COMPONENTS OF A THRIVING COMMUNITY ARE POSSIBLE THROUGH AFFORDABLEHIGH-SPEED BROADBAND. THE NENANA NATIVE ASSOCIATION NEEDS A MORE IN DEPTH, COMMUNITYTAILORED, AND ROBUST ENGINEERED APPROACH TO THEIR TRIBALLY OWNED NETWORK.SUCCESSFUL BROADBAND IMPLEMENTATION IS ONLY POSSIBLE WITH ENGINEERING. THE PROPOSEDFEASIBILITY STUDY FUNDED THROUGH NTBG WILL ASSIST NENANA NATIVE ASSOCIATION TO MAKE INFORMEDDECISIONS REGARDING DEPLOYMENT AND EXPANSION OF BROADBAND IN THEIR COMMUNITY. IT WILL PROVIDEDATA NEEDED FOR AN OPTIMIZED NETWORK INFRASTRUCTURE. CONSIDERATION OF FINANCIAL AND PRACTICALRISKS ASSOCIATED WITH DEVELOPING A BROADBAND NETWORK WILL BE A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF THEFEASIBILITY STUDY. THIS WILL BE THE FOUNDATION FOR NENANA NATIVE ASSOCIATION TO BUILD CAPACITY ANDTO SUCCESSFULLY OWN THEIR NETWORK.NENANA NATIVE ASSOCIATION IMPLICITLY COMMITS TO ALL CRITICAL PRIORITIZATION AREAS OF THENTBG PROGRAM AND WILL INVARIABLY REMAIN A BROADBAND ADVOCATE FOR THE HOUSEHOLDS, BUSINESSES,AND TRIBAL MEMBERS OF NENANA, ALASKA.

FBIC WILL ANALYZE THE KEY DATA RELEVANT TO UNDERSTANDING CURRENT INFRASTRUCTURE EXTENSION, DELIVERY, AND ITS LIMITATIONS INCLUDING THE MIDDLE MILE INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONNECT ANY FUTURE SERVICES BY EITHER THE INCUMBENT OR A NEW PROVIDER. WE WILL DETERMINE THE CURRENT LEVEL OF THE TRIBES TECHNICAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, ORGANIZATIONAL, AND MANAGEMENT CAPACITY FOR BROADBAND DEVELOPMENT. FBIC WILL ALSO DETERMINE WHICH TECHNICAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, OR ORGANIZATIONAL AND MANAGEMENT CAPACITIES FOR BROADBAND DEVELOPMENT WILL NEED ENHANCEMENT. IMPORTANT INPUTS ANALYZED AND THEN COMBINED INTO THE REPORT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: BROADBAND: ANALYZE AND IDENTIFY USAGE, DEMAND, INCUMBENT INTERNET RATES, SERVICE TOWERS, GROUND-LAID BROADBAND WIRING, AND INTERCONNECTING MIDDLE MILE MEANS. ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND WORKFORCE EXPANSION (REMOTE WORK CAPABILITIES) FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS.BROADBAND USE AND ADOPTION REPORT - EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS, EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND LOCAL OR REMOTE EDUCATIONAL LEARNING CAPABILITIES.LEGAL REGULATORY: REVIEW RIGHT OF WAYS, TRIBAL CONSTITUTION, LEASES, PERMITTING, AND RULINGS WITHIN AND WITHOUT RELEVANT TO TRIBE HISTORY, ALONG WITH AN EVALUATION OF THE KEY CONTRACTUAL UNDERPINNINGS REQUIRED TO FORM A TRIBAL SERVICE PROVIDER. ORGANIZATIONAL: ASSIST THE TRIBE IN DETERMINING THE OPTIMAL OWNERSHIP STRUCTURE BASED ON EXISTING TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS, ENTERPRISES, COMMITTEES, AND LEADERSHIP INPUT OPPORTUNITIES AND OR LIMITATIONS. FINANCE: IDENTIFY ECONOMIC DRIVERS WITHIN AND OUTSIDE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY. FURTHER DEFINE AND QUANTIFY THE RELATIVE IMPORTANCE IMPACT OF KEY PERFORMANCE METRICS, AND OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS, AND DEFINE TIMELINES THAT MAY BE INTEGRAL TO MEETING PARTICULAR STATE OR FEDERAL INCENTIVES OR OTHER TIME-SENSITIVE REQUIREMENTS WHICH AFFECT ECONOMICS. THERE WILL ALSO BE A REVIEW OF CURRENT AND FUTURE GRANT, LOAN, OR OTHER PROGRAMS FOR THE DEPLOYMENT OF NEW OR EXPANDED BROADBAND CAPABILITIES ON THE RESERVATION AND WHAT ARE THE REQUIREMENTS (MONTANA HAS SEVERAL RESTRICTIONS ON NON-ETC S FROM GAINING BROADBAND DEVELOPMENT FUNDS). THIS STUDY WILL ENCOMPASS THE EXISTING, PLANNED, OR REQUESTED MIDDLE MILE INFRASTRUCTURE AND ALSO CHANGES TO THE OVERALL RESERVATION AREA WITH TRIBAL MEMBERS MOVING BACK TO THE RESERVATION DUE TO THE ECONOMIC CLIMATE, NEW HOUSING COMMUNITIES BEING DEVELOPED AND REQUIRING SIGNIFICANT BROADBAND EXPANSION, WHILE ALSO WORKING TO IDENTIFY AND ESTIMATE THE EXPANSION OR IMPLEMENTATION OF SERVICES ON THE TRIBAL RESERVATION CONSIDERING OVER HALF OF THE RESERVATION LACKS HIGH-SPEED BROADBAND AND 100  OF THE RESERVATION IS LACKING STABLE, RELIABLE, AND AFFORDABLE BROADBAND THAT STILL DOES NOT FALL WITHIN THE NTIAS OR FCCS CLASSIFICATION OF SERVED.  THE FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL PROVIDE A REPORT TO ANSWER THE FOLLOWING ITEMS - AN ESTIMATE OF THE COST OF BUILDING OR EXPANDING A BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE BY EITHER A NEW ORGANIZATION OR THE INCUMBENT  A DETERMINATION OF THE TRANSMISSION MEDIUM(S) THAT WILL BE EMPLOYED (MIDDLE MILE INFRASTRUCTURE AND TIER-1 PROVIDERS)  IDENTIFICATION OF POTENTIAL FUNDING AND OR FINANCING FOR THE DEPLOYMENT  AND CONSIDERATION OF FINANCIAL AND PRACTICAL RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH DEVELOPING A BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE  WHAT WILL BE THE ADDITIONAL COSTS TO THE INCUMBENT OR TO A NEW ORGANIZATION AND ACCOUNT FOR THE AFFORDABLE CONNECTIVITY PROGRAM OR OTHER OPTIONS TO HELP DRIVE AFFORDABILITY AND BROADBAND OBTAINMENT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE NEXT PORTION OF THIS PLAN THROUGH THIS FEASIBILITY STUDY WOULD BE TO IDENTIFY HOW THIS BROADBAND WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND THEN ADDRESS TRIBAL NEEDS TO SPUR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIAL ACTIVITY (JOB CREATION AND RETENTION), CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, ENHANCE EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND REMOTE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, AND IMPROVE PUBLIC SAFETY.

THE NANSEMOND INDIAN NATION (NANSEMOND OR THE TRIBE) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIANTRIBE LOCATED PRIMARILY IN THE CITY OF SUFFOLK IN SOUTHEASTERN VIRGINIA. THE TRIBE OWNS SEVERALDISTINCT PARCELS OF LAND, BUT FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS TOURISM FOCUSED PROJECT, MATTANOCK TOWN ISTHE MOST RELEVANT PROPERTY. PRESENT DAY MATTANOCK TOWN CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 70 ACRES OFANCESTRAL LAND ALONG THE NANSEMOND RIVER, A 20 MILE LONG TRIBUTARY OF THE JAMES RIVER. WERECEIVED THIS PROPERTY FROM THE CITY OF SUFFOLK IN 2013 AND NAMED IT AFTER ONE OF OUR HISTORICVILLAGES. MATTANOCK TOWN HAS SWIFTLY BECOME THE CENTER OF OUR NANSEMOND INDIAN NATIONACTIVITIES, HOUSING OUR GOVERNMENT OFFICE BUILDING AND OUR SOON TO BE EXPANDED TRIBAL LODGE,WHICH SERVES AS OUR COMMUNITY CENTER AND GATHERING PLACE. THE RESTORATION OF THIS PARCEL OFLAND TO OUR TRIBAL CONTROL HAS BEEN CRITICAL TO REPAIRING THE FRAYED CONNECTION BETWEEN THENANSEMOND PEOPLE AND THE RIVER THAT HAS SUSTAINED US FOR EONS. WE BELIEVE THE TOURISMPOTENTIAL OF THIS BEAUTIFUL, BIODIVERSE RIVERFRONT SITE ALSO OFFERS US THE MEANS TO SUSTAIN OUR TRIBEECONOMICALLY WHILE FULFILLING OUR DUTY AS STEWARDS OF THIS RIVER AND ITS SURROUNDING LANDS. OURTRIBAL CITIZENS, ELECTED LEADERSHIP, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ADVISORS HAVE DISCUSSED POSSIBLERECREATION AND ECOTOURISM ACTIVITIES AT MATTANOCK TOWN INCLUDING GUIDED KAYAK TOURS OF THESURROUNDING WATERWAYS, OVERNIGHT LODGING DESIGNED IN TRADITIONAL NANSEMOND STYLE WHILEINCORPORATING MODERN AMENITIES, AND DINING EXPERIENCES THAT EXPLORE NATIVE FOODWAYS IN OURLODGE. THE PROPOSED MATTANOCK TOWN ECOTOURISM CENTER FEASIBILITY STUDY AND BUSINESS PLANTRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM (TTGP) STUDY WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO IDENTIFY A LIST OF POSSIBLEECOTOURISM ACTIVITIES, TO SELECT THOSE OPPORTUNITIES WHICH ARE ECONOMICALLY VIABLE ANDCONSISTENT WITH OUR TRIBAL VALUES AND GOALS, AND TO DEVELOP A FINANCIAL AND OPERATING PLAN TOLAUNCH THESE ACTIVITIES AT MATTANOCK TOWN.

THE MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION (MCN) IS THE FOURTH LARGEST FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE IN THE UNITED STATES WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 97,343 CITIZENS  MORE THAN HALF OF WHOM LIVE WITHIN THE TRIBAL RESERVATION. MCN TRIBAL HEADQUARTERS ARE CENTRALLY SITUATED WITHIN THE NATION S JURISDICTION IN THE CITY OF OKMULGEE. THE SERVICE AREA CONSISTS OF URBAN, RURAL, AND VERY RURAL REMOTE AREAS. POPULATION DENSITIES VARY FROM SMALL UNINCORPORATED COMMUNITIES, WITH FEWER THAN 50 RESIDENTS, TO TULSA, ONE OF THE LARGEST URBAN AREAS WITHIN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA.      SPANNING NEARLY 5,000 SQUARE MILES, THE MCN RESERVATION INCLUDES ELEVEN COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL OKLAHOMA, INCLUDING TWO DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONES. THE JURISDICTION IS DIVIDED INTO EIGHT DISTRICTS CORRESPONDING NAMELY WITH THE COUNTIES OF CREEK, MCINTOSH, MUSKOGEE, OKFUSKEE, OKMULGEE, AND PORTIONS OF WAGONER, TULSA, ROGERS, HUGHES, SEMINOLE, AND MAYES. THE NATION PROVIDES VITAL SERVICES SUCH AS HEALTH CARE, HOUSING, EDUCATION ASSISTANCE, SOCIAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, CULTURE AND LANGUAGE PRESERVATION, AND OTHER BASIC GOVERNMENT FUNCTIONS AND SERVICES.     MCN IS PLEASED TO SUBMIT THIS APPLICATION FOR THIS GRANT WHICH WILL SUPPORT FURTHER ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT TO HELP SUSTAIN OUR COMMUNITY IN THE FUTURE. THE NATION IS APPLYING TO THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS, TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM  SOLICITATION OF PROPOSALS FOR FUNDING FROM THE TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM. MCN WILL UTILIZE THE FUNDING TO PERFORM A TOURISM PROJECT MARKET ASSESSMENT AND FEASIBILITY STUDY AND DEVELOP A TOURISM FIVE YEAR BUSINESS PLAN TO CONNECT THE HISTORICAL PAST OF THE NATION TO A CONTEMPORARY PRESENCE. THIS WILL BE COMPLETED TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF INTERNATIONAL TOURISM, BUS TOURS, WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT, UNIFYING TOURISM WITH GAMING INITIATIVES, CREATING MORE COHESIVE GIFT SHOPS, AND PARTICIPATION IN THE ROUTE 66  ROAD AHEAD INITIATIVE.     THE NATION IS REQUESTING  149,423 IN FEDERAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THIS PROJECT WHICH, IF REALIZED, WILL BE USED TO MEET THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND PRESENTS AN OPPORTUNITY FOR MCN TO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE SUSTAINABILITY OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE TOURISM INDUSTRY. THIS PROJECT IS IN KEEPING WITH THE TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM ELIGIBLE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TO OBTAIN TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PERFORM FEASIBILITY STUDIES OR DEVELOP TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLANS AND WILL NOT DUPLICATE PREVIOUS WORK.

FOR THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM, THE INDIAN PUEBLO CULTURAL CENTER IS SEEKING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICOS BUREAU OF BUSINESS AND ECONOMIC RESEARCH (BBER) TO ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF BUSINESS AND CULTURAL PROGRAM OPPORTUNITIES IN CONNECTION WITH THE CULTURAL CENTERS LONG TERM MASTER PLAN. THE SPIRIT LAKE TRIBE S SPIRIT LAKE TRIBAL TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY INTO THE SPIRIT LAKE TRIBES TOURISM ASSETS, WHICH WILL DELIVER A TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN. IN PARTICULAR, THE TRIBE AIMS TO DETERMINE THE BASELINE ECONOMIC FEASIBILITY OF BUILDING OUT THE TOURISM ASSETS PRIORITIZED IN THE 2022 SPIRIT LAKE CASINO AND  RESORT MASTER PLAN.SPIRIT LAKE TRIBES PROSPERITY DIRECTLY DEPENDS UPON CREATING A VIBRANT LOCAL ECONOMY, WHICH WILL PROVIDE  INCOME  TO  OUR  TRIBE  AND  QUALITY  JOB  OPPORTUNITIES  FOR  OUR  TRIBAL  MEMBERS.  ONE  WAY  IN  WHICH WE AIM TO EXPAND OUR ECONOMY IS BY CREATING TOURISM ASSETS ON THE SPIRIT LAKE RESERVATION. THIS  TRIBAL  TOURISM  FEASIBILITY  STUDY  WILL  REVIEW  SPIRIT  LAKES  EXISTING  TRIBAL  TOURISM  ASSETS,  REVIEW  NEW  OPERATION  COST  ASSUMPTIONS,  CONFIRM  MARKET  DYNAMICS  OF  THE  RESERVATIONS  TOURISM  ECONOMY,  DEVELOP  BUSINESS  CASES,  AND  OUTREACH  TO  POTENTIAL  THIRD  PARTY  OPERATORS  TO  UNDERSTAND  POTENTIAL TERMS OF PARTNERSHIPS. THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE FOUR (4) PHASES. FIRST, THE PROJECT DEFINITION PHASE WILL OUTLINE THE INITIATIVES AND SCOPE SCENARIOS OF THOSE INDIVIDUAL PROJECT OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING HOW THEY COULD SUPPLEMENT OR  ENHANCE  EXISTING  TOURISM  ASSETS.  SECOND,  THE  TRIBE  WILL  HIRE  A  QUALIFIED  ARCHITECTURAL  AND   ENGINEERING (A E) FIRM TO DEVELOP CONCEPTUAL DESIGN AND BUDGETARY INFORMATION, SO THAT THE TRIBE CAN USE THE INPUTS TO DEVELOP A TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS CASE. THIRD, A COMPREHENSIVE PROJECT PRO FORMA MODEL AND SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS WILL BE DEVELOPED, CONSIDERING THE CAPITAL BUDGET, FUNDING STRUCTURE, REVENUE GENERATORS, AND OPERATIONAL COST VARIABLES. FINALLY, THE FOURTH PHASE WILL IDENTIFY CAPITAL STACK AND FUNDING STRATEGY SCENARIOS TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT.THE FINAL FINDINGS WILL INCLUDE A CLEAR PROJECT TIMELINE, POTENTIAL RISKS, AND NEXT STEPS FOR THE TRIBE. AT  THE  COMPLETION  OF  THIS  PROPOSED  PROJECT,  THE  TRIBE  WILL  BE  ABLE  TO  UNDERSTAND  HOW  TO  BEST  LEVERAGE ITS TOURISM ASSETS TO BUILD ITS ECONOMY AND WILL HAVE A DETAILED PLAN FOR MOVING FORWARD.

THE APSALOOKE TOURISM ACTION PLAN IS A STREAMLINED AND COORDINATED STRUCTURE FOR TOURISM DEVELOPMENT PLANNING ON THE CROW INDIAN RESERVATION, WHICH IS HOME TO RICH NATURAL LANDSCAPES AND WATERWAYS. ACTIVITIES ON THE RESERVATION INCLUDE HERITAGE TOURS, HUNTING, FISHING, AND BOATING AND THESE ACTIVITIES GENERATE TOURISM FOR THE REGION. LIKEWISE, LOCAL FISHING AND HUNTING OUTFITTERS AND BOATING RENTALS MAKE A LARGE PROFIT DURING PEAK SEASON.THE BIA TTGP WOULD DRAMATICALLY STRENGTHEN THE CROW TRIBES ABILITY TO DEVELOP TOURISM ON THE RESERVATION IN FIVE KEY AREAS WHICH HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS STRONGLY SUPPORTED AND HIGHEST PRIORITY BY BOTH THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO CREATE A SUSTAINABLE, SUCCESSFUL, AND INCREASED FLOW OF TOURISM TO THE RESERVATION  THE TEEPEE CAPITAL OF THE WORLD CAMPGROUND MODERNIZATIONS AND ENHANCEMENT WILL BRING THE APSALOOKE ROLE AS THE MOST GRACIOUS HOSTS TO THE FOREFRONT BY UPGRADING OUR CROW FAIRGROUNDS FOR A MORE ENJOYABLE AND CONVENIENT EXPERIENCE BY PROVIDING RESTROOMS, SHOWERS, SECURITY LIGHTING, LIGHTED PATHWAYS, SIGNAGE, AND STREET SIGNS FOR EASE OF NAVIGATION, SEASONAL RV HOOKUPS, AND CAMPGROUNDS SITES. APSALOOKE CURATION FACILITY AND CULTURAL MUSEUM REQUIRES A BUSINESS PLAN TO IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICES FOR MUSEUM OPERATIONS AND TO ENABLE LONG TERM SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. THIS CURATION FACILITY WOULD ALLOW THE CROW TRIBE TO REPATRIATE OUR SIGNIFICANT CULTURAL HISTORICAL ITEMS IN OUR OWN FACILITY. THIS ACTUALIZES OUR SOVEREIGNTY BY CARING FOR, DISPLAYING, GIVING US AGENCY IN OUR OWN STORY AND HISTORY, THE AUTONOMY TO UTILIZE OUR OWN CULTURAL ITEMS, AND TAKING BACK OUR PAST AND CULTURE NOW AND FOR OUR FUTURE GENERATIONS.BIG METAL TOURISM INITIATIVE WILL MAXIMIZE TOURISM DOLLARS FROM THE NATURAL SPLENDOR OF THE BIG HORN VALLEY.  THE TOURISM ACTIVITIES IN BIGHORN VALLEY NEED A BUSINESS PLAN FOR THE OK A BEH MARINA CONCESSIONS INCLUDING BOAT AND PONTOON RENTALS, FOOD CONCESSIONS, GAS SALES, AND CAMPGROUNDS AT THE AFTERBAY AREA, ADDING ACTIVITIES LIKE RECREATIONAL CRUISES, HERITAGE TOURS, AND CENTRALIZING FISHING AND OUTFITTING PERMITS.BAAAHKASHE LODGING ACCOMMODATIONS AND AMENITIES PROJECT IS A FEASIBILITY STUDY TO CREATE A FACILITY FOR LODGING ACCOMMODATIONS THAT INCLUDE AN EVENTS CENTER, A GATHERING PLACE, A CONFERENCE FACILITY, AND OTHER POSSIBLE GUEST SERVICES AND AMENITIES. BAAAHKASHE IS THE CROW WORD FOR LARGE GATHERING. LODGING NEAR THE LITTLE BIG HORN BATTLEFIELD AND CROW FAIR CELEBRATION HAS BEEN A CONSTANT AND GLARING NEED THAT WE WISH TO FULFILL FOR OUR VISITING GUESTS. THE NEAREST HOTELS ARE 12 MILES AWAY, WHICH ARE NORMALLY SOLD OUT DURING THE BUSY TIMES WHEN THE NEED FOR OUR GUESTS IS THE GREATEST. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE LIMITED LOCAL CHOICES FOR AFFORDABLE, CONVENIENT, CLOSE LOCATIONS FOR MEETING, TRAININGS, AND CONFERENCES. APSALOOKE CULTURAL ENTREPRENEUR MARKET REQUIRES A FEASIBILITY STUDY TO DETERMINE THE MOST BENEFICIAL AND SUSTAINABLE WAY TO ASSIST OUR CROW OWNED TOURISM BASED BUSINESSES AND ARTISANS WITH A SPACE TO OFFER SERVICES TO CUSTOMERS. THIS CAN INCLUDE A GIFT SHOP, A LOCAL MARKET, VENDOR STALLS, AN ART MARKET, AND HOW THE CROW TRIBE CAN FACILITATE THESE ENTREPRENEURS.THE ULTIMATE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BRING SIGNIFICANT SUCCESS AND SUSTAINABILITY TO TOURISM INITIATIVES FOR THE CROW TRIBE, WHICH IN TURN WILL HOLISTICALLY STRENGTHEN A COMMUNITY BURSTING WITH CULTURAL AND HISTORICAL TRADITION, PRESERVING AND SHARING THAT CULTURE FOR GENERATIONS TO COME.THE APSALOOKE TOURISM ACTION PLAN HAS THE POTENTIAL TO LAUNCH THE CROW TRIBES GROWING INVESTMENT IN TOURISM BY PROVIDING THE BLUEPRINT FOR WHAT EXACTLY TO IMPLEMENT FOR THE MOST SUCCESSFUL, SUSTAINABLE OUTCOMES. ONCE SPECIFIC PLANS ARE IN HAND FOR THE FIVE IDENTIFIED PROJECTS, THE TRIBE CAN PROCEED WITH THE NEXT STAGE TO FULLY REALIZE THOSE INITIATIVES IN A COST EFFECTIVE, EFFICIENT, AND TIMELY MANNER.

IT WILL DEMONSTRATE THE HEALING POWER OF TRADITIONAL AND MODERN INDIGENOUS PRACTICES OF LAND STEWARDSHIP AND SUSTAINABILITY, AS WELL AS PROVIDE SPACES FOR THOSE WISHING TO ENGAGE IN HEALING AND WELLNESS. THE ASSESSMENT WILL ALLOW WPHW AND HBMI TO EXPLORE WAYS OF IMPROVING INFRASTRUCTURE, BUSINESS PRACTICES, AND PROMPTING WABANAKI HOSPITALITY, BY PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCES THAT DEMONSTRATE THE KNOWLEDGE, SOVEREIGNTY, AND LONGEVITY OF THE WABANAKI PEOPLE. THIS PROCESS WITH INCLUDE ENGAGING WABANAKI KNOWLEDGE KEEPERS IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE FEASIBILITY STUDY AND RESULTING PLANS. COMPONENTS OF THE PROPOSED FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE WABANAKI WAY WILL INCLUDE ASSESSMENTS SUPPORTING WPHWS TRIBAL TOURISM FOR THE CAMPGROUND AT THE GATHERING PLACE IN MILLINOCKET MAINE, AS WELL AS ASSESSMENTS FOR BROADLY CONNECTING TO AND SUSTAINING THE HOULTON BAND OF MALISEET INDIANS TRIBAL TOURISM WORK AT WOLASTOQ INN AND SUITES AND WILDERNESS PINES CAMPGROUND. AS A PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATION WHICH FOCUSES ON REDUCING BARRIERS AND IMPROVING HEALTH WITHIN THE FIVE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBAL COMMUNITIES OF MAINE, FOR PROFIT WORK WOULD BE A NEW INITIATIVE FOR THE ORGANIZATION AND DOES NOT DUPLICATE ANY PREVIOUS WORK. THIS BUSINESS STEP IS NECESSARY TO PROVIDE FURTHER ECONOMIC SUPPORT AND RESILIENCY FOR WABANAKI PEOPLE, AND TO CREATE A STREAM OF REVENUE THAT IS INDEPENDENT OF PHILANTHROPIC OR GOVERNMENTAL SYSTEMS TO SUPPORT WPHW HEALING AND RECOVERY PROGRAMMING. THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE WABANAKI WAY WILL ALLOW US TO INVEST IN OUR COLLABORATIVE WORK WITH HBMI AND USM, AND TO BUILD A FOUNDATIONAL CAPACITY AND INDEPENDENT REVENUE STREAM TO PROMOTE SOVEREIGNTY, WELL BEING, RESILIENCY, AND COMMUNITY HEALING.

ABSTRACT   THE PENOBSCOT NATION SEEKS A TOTAL OF  150,000 TO ADVANCE THE PENOBSCOT INDIAN NATION TOURISM DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE.  PROJECT GOAL  THE PENOBSCOT NATION IS RECOGNIZED AS A LEADER INTERNATIONALLY FOR DELIVERING A COMPREHENSIVE, HIGH QUALITY TOURISM EXPERIENCE CENTERED ON PENOBSCOT CULTURE THAT  CAPTURES THE ESSENCE OF PLACE AND THE TRIBES RELATIONSHIP WITH THE PENOBSCOT RIVER, MOUNT KATAHDIN, AND THE MAINE WOODS CREATES SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY FOR TRIBAL CITIZENS THAT INCREASES HOUSEHOLD INCOME, EXPANDS EMPLOYMENT, AND LEADS TO ECONOMIC SELF SUFFICIENCY STRENGTHENS PURPOSE AND MEANING ASSOCIATED WITH BEING PENOBSCOT FOR TRIBAL CITIZENS THROUGH GREATER CONNECTION TO CULTURAL TRADITIONS, PRACTICES, AND STORIES HIGHLIGHTS SHOWCASES THE AMAZING ENVIRONMENTAL ASSETS THE PENOBSCOT HAVE ENJOYED FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS  AND CELEBRATES PENOBSCOT TRADITIONS AND WAYS OF INTERACTING WITH THE EARTH.PROJECT OBJECTIVE  OVER A 12 MONTH PERIOD, THE PENOBSCOT WILL ENGAGE IN A TOURISM INITIATIVE THAT STRENGTHENS AND EXPANDS THE TRIBES TOURISM SECTOR THROUGH INVESTMENT IN PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, CULTURAL TRAINING, TOURISM INFRASTRUCTURE, AND MARKET DEVELOPMENT.  THE INITIATIVE WILL DRAW FROM PENOBSCOT CULTURE, ENGAGE THE PENOBSCOT PEOPLE, UTILIZE SOUND MARKET RESEARCH TO DETERMINE PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, ADHERE TO BEST PRACTICES IN TOURISM OPERATIONS AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, FULLY LEVERAGE THE EXPERIENCE BASED ECONOMY, AND SUPPORT TOURISM CAPACITY BUILDING OF TRIBAL GOVERNMENT, TRIBAL PROGRAMS, AND NATIVE ARTISANS ENTREPRENEURS.  TO ACHIEVE THE PROJECT GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, THE PENOBSCOT TOURISM DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE WILL ENGAGE IN A COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROCESS THAT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING ASSESSMENT OF PENOBSCOT TERRITORY AND TRIBAL ASSETS,FEASIBILITY STUDY AND BUSINESS PLAN FOR LODGE SPORTS CAMP, GLAMPING LOCATIONS AND OR A SERIES OF SMALL HUTS CONNECTED THROUGH A TRAIL NETWORK (MULTIPLE LOCATIONS STUDIED).LODGING PRELIMINARY RENDERINGS, ENGINEERING, ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW, AND COST ESTIMATES.FEASIBILITY STUDY AND BUSINESS PLAN FOR A NATIVE GUIDE AND ARTISAN COOPERATIVE.ASSESSMENT OF AND PROGRAM DESIGN FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR NATIVE GUIDES, ARTISANS, AND ENTREPRENEURS WORKING IN THE TOURISM SECTOR.UPDATE TRIBAL DIRECTORY OF NATIVE GUIDES, ARTISANS, ENTREPRENEURS, CULTURAL PRACTITIONERS.ESTABLISH AN INTEGRATED TOURISM DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY THAT CONSIDERS ALL THAT IS OUTLINED ABOVE, AS WELL AS EXISTING ASSETS, INFRASTRUCTURE, PROGRAMS, AND OFFERINGS.FUND DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY THAT INCLUDES STARTUP CAPITAL, PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, ORGANIZATION CAPACITY BUILDING, AND SUSTAINABILITY.

THE PRAIRIE BAND POTAWATOMI NATION (PBPN OR THE NATION) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE LOCATED IN RURAL NORTHEAST KANSAS. WHILE PRIMARILY BASED IN KANSAS, PBPN ALSO HAS AN EXISTING RESERVATION NEAR SHABBONA, ILLINOIS IT WISHES TO EVALUATE FOR DEVELOPMENT OPTIONS THAT COULD BRING TOURISM AND REVENUE TO THE NATION. THE NATION OWNS 129 ACRES OF LAND ON THE EXISTING SHABBONA RESERVATION, AND DEVELOPMENT OF THIS LAND HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC BENEFIT TO THE NATION, PROMOTE TRIBAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, JOB CREATION, AND TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY. THIS PROPOSAL, ENTITLED PRAIRIE BAND POTAWATOMI NATION SHABBONA ANALYSIS, REQUESTS  82,764 TO COMPLETE A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR DEVELOPMENT ON THE EXISTING SHABBONA RESERVATION CONSISTING OF A CULTURAL CENTER, LODGING AND DINING, AND RETAIL. THE CONSULTANT WILL ALSO DEVELOP A SHORT LIST SET OF ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPTIONS THAT COULD BRING ECONOMIC BENEFIT TO PBPN. THIS ANALYSIS WILL HELP THE NATION UNDERSTAND THE COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE FOR DEVELOPMENT, EVALUATE DEMAND AND REVENUE POTENTIAL, AND MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE NATIONS LAND ON THE SHABBONA RESERVATION.

NEZ PERCE TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN BIA TTGP FUNDING WILL ENABLE THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE TO CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN OVER THE NEXT YEAR TO HELP GUIDE SOUND PLANNING AND DECISION MAKING FOR THE TRIBE S COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE IS RECOGNIZED NATIONALLY AND THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TOURISM DEVELOPMENT, BRANDING, AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT. STEVE PETERSON OF THE UNIVERSITY OF IDAHO WHO IS THE REGIONAL ECONOMIST FOR THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE REGION IN NORTH CENTRAL IDAHO WILL WORK WITH TRIBAL LEADERSHIP AND PLANNERS TO DEVELOP THE NEZ PERCE TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN. PROJECT COLLABORATORS INCLUDE NEZ PERCE TRIBAL COUNCIL, NEZ PERCE OFFICE OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTION, NEZ PERCE ENTERPRISES, NEZ PERCE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, AND THE TRIBE S PLANNING TEAM, WHICH IS COMPRISED OF MANAGERS OF SEVERAL TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS. DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEZ PERCE TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN WILL BUILD UPON THE SUCCESS OF THE RECENTLY COMPLETED, BIA FUNDED TRIBAL TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE NEZ PERCE BY FOCUSING ON AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE FEASIBILITY STUDY AS HAVING GREATEST TOURISM POTENTIAL. THE BUSINESS PLAN WILL LAY OUT A FRAMEWORK FOR ACTUAL IMPLEMENTATION OF PROFIT MAKING BUSINESS OPERATIONS FOR THE TRIBE ITSELF AND EMERGING AND EXPANDING TRIBAL BUSINESSES ENGAGED IN TOURISM AND OUTDOOR RECREATION. THE BUSINESS PLAN WILL EMPOWER THE NEZ PERCE COMMUNITY TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT BY CONDUCTING A MARKETING ANALYSIS, IDENTIFYING STRONG BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE LIKELY TO GENERATE REVENUE AND SUSTAIN TRIBAL TOURISM BUSINESSES, AND POTENTIAL ECONOMIC GROWTH FOR TOURISM AS A KEY NEZ PERCE INDUSTRY. THE RESULTING INCREASE IN TRIBAL TOURISM ON THE RESERVATION WILL HELP CREATE JOBS AND BUILD THRIVING COMMUNITIES ACROSS THIS RURAL REGION.

THE ELK VALLEY RANCHERIA, CALIFORNIA, A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE (THE TRIBE), IS RESPECTFULLY SUBMITTING THE ELK VALLEY RANCHERIA RV PARK FEASIBILITY STUDY PROJECT TO THE BIA OFFICE OF INDIAN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM IN ORDER TO COMPLETE AN ECONOMIC FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR DEVELOPMENT OF AN RV PARK (THE PROJECT) ON RESERVATION TRUST LAND.  THE TRIBE WILL UTILIZE THE SERVICES OF A QUALIFIED CONSULTANT (PRO FORMA ADVISORS), WHOM HAVE BEEN A PROVEN PARTNER ON OTHER FEASIBILITY STUDY PROJECTS ON THE TRIBES PROPERTY.  THE TRIBES RESERVATION IS LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE REDWOODS NATIONAL AND STATE PARK WHICH RECEIVES OVER A MILLION VISITORS EACH YEAR.  THE TRIBE IS HOPING TO DEVELOP TOURISM BASED SERVICES ON ADJACENT RESERVATION LANDS THAT WILL CATER TO THESE VISITORS, THEREBY BRINGING MUCH NEEDED REVENUES TO THE TRIBAL ECONOMY.  THE RV PARK WOULD BE DEVELOPED WITHIN THE FOOTPRINT OF A RECREATIONAL RESORT THAT INCLUDES AN EXISTING CASINO, A FUTURE HOTEL, AND FUTURE RECREATIONAL HIKING TRAILS WILDLIFE VIEWING PLATFORMS.   THE STUDY WILL BE USED TO QUANTIFY THE REVENUE AND PROFITABILITY POTENTIAL OF THE RV PARK, INCLUDING ACHIEVABLE SLIP OCCUPANCY, AVERAGE DAILY RATE, EXPECTED NET PROFITABILITY, EXPECTED DEVELOPMENT COST, AND INVESTMENT POTENTIAL.  THE TRIBE WILL UTILIZE THE FEASIBILITY STUDY TO MAKE AN INFORMED DECISION PRIOR TO FULL DEVELOPMENT.  THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PURSUE A HIGHLY ATTRACTIVE TOURISM BASED ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECT THAT WILL SERVE TO PROVIDE INCREASED EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, IMPROVE THE SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS OF THE TRIBE, INCREASE FUNDING FOR A VARIETY OF SOCIAL, GOVERNMENTAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, EDUCATIONAL, HEALTH AND WELFARE SERVICES, PROVIDE REVENUE TO RESTORE THE LOST LAND BASE, TO PROVIDE CAPITAL FOR OTHER ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO PROVIDE FOR ECONOMIC SELF SUFFICIENCY.

THE ENTERPRISE RANCHERIA MAIDU TRIBE OF CALIFORNIA, ALSO KNOWN AS THE ENTERPRISE RANCHERIA YUMEKA MAIDU (TRIBE), HAS 40 ACRES OF TRUST LAND IN YUBA COUNTY WHERE IT OPERATES ITS CASINO AND HOTEL, THE HARD ROCK HOTEL AND CASINO SACRAMENTO AT FIRE MOUNTAIN (CASINO).  IT IS IN A UNIQUE ZONING DESIGNATION KNOWN AS THE THE YUBA COUNTY SPORTS AND ENTERTAINMENT ZONE (YSEZ). THE YSEZ IS APPROXIMATELY 1,000 ACRES AND IS FIVE MILES SOUTH OF MARYSVILLE, CALIFORNIA, AND IS ALSO HOME TO THE 18,500 SEAT TOYOTA AMPHITHEATRE. THE TRIBE HAS AN OPTION FOR 352 ACRES LOCATED BETWEEN THE EXISTING 40 ACRES TRUST LAND PARCEL AND THE TOYOTA AMPHITHEATER WITH FINAL PAYOFF SCHEDULED FOR 2023. THE TRIBE INTENDS TO PLACE THE LAND IN TRUST SINCE IT IS CONTIGUOUS TO TRUST LAND, ALTHOUGH IT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR GAMING. WITH THE UNIQUE DESIGNATION OF THE YSEZ, THE TRIBE HAS A WONDERFUL OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP A DESIRABLE TOURISM DESIGNATION. THIS OPPORTUNITY IS WHY A PROFESSIONAL FEASIBILITY STUDY IS NEEDED.

THE MESA GRANDE BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (BDC), THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ARM OF THE MESA GRANDE BAND OF MISSION INDIANS, IS REQUESTING  149,212 FOR THE PURPOSE OF  PRODUCING  A COMPREHENSIVE BUSINESS PLAN FOR THE OPERATION AND MARKETING OF THE TRIBE S GOLDEN EAGLE FARM AS AN AGRITOURISM DESTINATION. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE A SMALL GROUP OF INDEPENDENT EXPERTS IN DEVELOPING THE BUSINESS PLAN, EACH ADDRESSING SPECIFIC TOPIC AREAS IN WHICH THEY HAVE SPECIAL EXPERTISE. THE FINAL INTEGRATED PLAN, WHEN IMPLEMENTED, WILL HELP THE BDC BUILD TRIBAL TOURISM CAPACITY, INCREASE REVENUES, ADDRESS PERSISTENT ECONOMIC CHALLENGES FACING THE TRIBE AND ITS CITIZENS, AND FOSTER SUSTAINABLE LONG TERM BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT.THE CONSULTING TEAM WILL PRODUCE A SERIES OF TECHNICAL MEMORANDA (DELIVERABLES) DESCRIBING EXISTING AND POTENTIAL AGRITOURISM ASSETS, RECOMMENDED MARKETING STRATEGY, RECOMMENDED OPERATIONS AND MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE, AND ESTIMATED REVENUE EXPENSE PROJECTIONS. THESE DELIVERABLES WILL FORM THE BASIS FOR THE FINAL BUSINESS PLAN. THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE GOLDEN EAGLE FARM AS AN AGRITOURISM DESTINATION IS SUSTAINABLE FOR LONG TERM ECONOMIC BENEFIT. THE BDC HAS ALREADY PLANTED AND HARVESTED CROPS ON TWO ACRES OF GOLDEN EAGLE LAND. THREE RESIDENCES ON THE FARM ARE UNDER RENOVATION FOR USE AS SHORT TERM VACATION RENTALS. PLANS ARE UNDERWAY FOR GRADUAL REPAIRS AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE BARNS, STABLES AND OTHER EQUINE INFRASTRUCTURE TO ALLOW FOR THE HOSTING OF EQUINE GATHERINGS AND EVENTS.

THE HUALAPAI TRIBE IS REQUESTING FUNDS TO HIRE A CONSULTANT TO ASSIST THE TRIBE IN DEVELOPING A 10 YEAR PLAN FOR TOURISM DEVELOPMENT ON THE RESERVATION, ESPECIALLY IN THE DOWNTOWN AREA.   THE PROJECT NEEDS A TEAM WHO UNDERSTANDS RURAL NATIVE COMMUNITIES IN THE SOUTHWEST, HISTORIC BUILDING PRESERVATION, AND CAN PROJECT MARKET TRENDS FOR THE NEAR FUTURE.  THE TRIBE REQUESTING  150,000 TO COVER THE EXPENSE OF ATTENDING THE WORKSHOP IN WASHINGTON DC AND TO HIRE THE CONSULTING FIRM TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING EFFORTS.

THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF CHENEGA REQUESTS GRANT FUNDS FROM THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS (BIA) FOR THE TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM (TTGP).  CHENEGA IRA COUNCIL IS REQUESTING ONE TIME FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF  30,916 IN SUPPORT OF OUR HERITAGE TOURISM BUSINESS PLAN. THIS PLAN WILL ANALYZE THE INDEPENDENT TRAVELER MARKET WITH A DO IT YOURSELF FOCUS, AS OPPOSED TO A FULL SERVICE LODGE, THROUGH THE USE OF TRADITIONAL SUGPIAQ (SUGSTUN) THEMED DRY CABINS AND WELL ESTABLISHED TENT PLATFORMS.  THESE SITES WILL HAVE OTHER BOOSTED AMENITIES, SUCH AS WEATHER COVERAGE, BEAR DETERRENTS AND STORAGE, TRASH CONTAINERS, FIRE PITS WITH PROVIDED WOOD, AND OUTHOUSES. FROM THESE ESTABLISHED LOCATIONS, VISITORS ARE FREE TO EXPLORE PRINCE WILLIAM SOUND AND LEARN FROM INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE AND DISPLAYS LEARNING HISTORY, SCIENCE, CULTURE, THE TRADITIONAL LANGUAGE SUGPIAQ (SUGSTUN) SPOKEN BY THE ALUTIIQ PEOPLE.  CHARTER BOATS, KAYAK RENTALS AND GUIDE OPTIONS WILL BE PROVIDED AS CUSTOMERS TAILOR THEIR ADVENTURE NEEDS. THE STUDY WILL ALSO INCLUDE A TRANSPORTATION SERVICE ASPECT, PROVIDING RIDES TO AND FROM VARIOUS LOCATIONS.  THIS BUSINESS PLAN IS BASED ON A PRE FEASIBILITY STUDY CONDUCTED IN 2020, AND ITS ALIGNED WITH THE CHENEGA 2021 2026 COMMUNITY STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH IDENTIFIES THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NETWORK OF PROPERTIES THAT CAN GENERATE REVENUE THROUGH VISITATION AND PROVIDE A SPACE FOR CULTURE CAMP PROGRAMS AND IMPLEMENTATION.  EXPANDING TOURISM INCLUDES ENGAGING LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS AND UNLOCKING A RANGE OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESIDENTS, INCLUDING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, ACCESS TO EDUCATION, AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE CHENEGA IRA COUNCIL LOOKS FORWARD TO THE PRESENCE OF A ROBUST TRIBAL TOURISM PLAN IN PRINCE WILLIAM SOUND FOR REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT.

SITKA TRIBE OF ALASKA (STA) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED GOVERNMENT FOR MORE THAN 4,400 TRIBAL CITIZENS WHO ARE PRIMARILY OF TLINGIT, HAIDA, ALEUT, AND TSIMSHIAN HERITAGE IN SOUTHEAST ALASKA BASED IN SITKA, ALASKA. STA HOUSES SITKA TRIBAL ENTERPRISES (STE), NOT FOR PROFIT COMPANY THAT HAS BEEN IN OPERATION SINCE MAY OF 1994. STE OVERSEES SITKA TRIBAL TOURS, A LOCAL TOURISM PROGRAM THAT SEEKS TO PRESENT LOCAL NATIVE CULTURE IN A MANNER THAT IS POSITIVE AND INVIGORATING  ENSURING THAT VISITORS LEAVE SITKA WITH AN AUTHENTIC PERSPECTIVE ON THE TLINGIT CULTURE. SITKA TRIBAL TOURS SERVES TO PROVIDE BOTH ECONOMIC AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE LOCAL NATIVE COMMUNITY.OVER THE PAST DECADE SITKA TRIBAL TOURS HAS EXPERIENCED CHANGES IN MANAGEMENT, PRODUCT OFFERINGS, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS THE NATIONWIDE COVID 19 PANDEMIC THAT BROUGHT A HALT TO ALL TOURISM INITIATIVES. AS A RESULT, SITKA TRIBAL TOURS HAS HAD TO REBUILD FROM THE GROUND UP, AND AFTER A SUCCESSFUL BUT BUSY 2022 TOURISM SEASON, STA WOULD LIKE TO TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO WORK WITH A QUALIFIED AGENCY ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF A BUSINESS PLAN. THE LAST BUSINESS PLAN DEVELOPED FOR TRIBAL TOURS WAS COMPLETED IN 2006, AND DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR ALL OF THE CHANGES THE PROGRAM HAS UNDERGONE IN THE YEARS SINCE.STA HOPES TO UTILIZE THE BUSINESS PLAN AND THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE EXPERTS TO TRANSITION THE BUSINESS MODEL OF TRIBAL TOURS INTO A MORE SELF SUSTAINING, REVENUE GENERATING SOCIAL ENTERPRISE AS IT SOLVES KEY CHALLENGES AROUND INCREASING PROFITS AND DECREASING EXPENSES. STA ALSO HOPES TO CREATE A VIABLE MARKET FOR OFF SEASON TRAVEL, AND AS ALWAYS, TO BUILD A VIABLE TOURISM BUSINESS THAT WILL SUSTAIN, ENHANCE, PRESERVE, AND PERPETUATE THE TLINGIT HERITAGE AND  CULTURE THROUGH INNOVATIVE, ENTERPRISING CONCEPTS.

THE VILLAGE OF KAKTOVIK (AKA BARTER ISLAND) SEEKS FUNDING TO CONDUCT A POLAR BEAR TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY TO CONSIDER THE TECHNICAL, ECONOMIC, AND COMMUNITY FACTORS OF RE-IMPLEMENTING A POLAR BEAR TOURISM PROGRAM IN KAKTOVIK AS THE FIRST STEP TOWARDS CREATING A BUSINESS PLAN AND TOURISM PROGRAM THAT IS CULTURALLY RESPONSIBLE AND COMMUNITY-LED, AND THAT BRINGS ECONOMIC GROWTH AND OPPORTUNITIES TO KAKTOVIK. THE VILLAGE OF KAKTOVIK INTENDS TO WORK THROUGH THE TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM (TTGP) TO COLLABORATE WITH MCKINLEY RESEARCH GROUP (MRG) TO CONDUCT THIS STUDY AND DETERMINE THE BEST PATH FORWARD.

INTRODUCTIONHYDABURG, ALASKA, A REMOTE VILLAGE ON PRINCE OF WALES ISLAND, IS HOME TO ONE OF ONLY TWO HAIDA TRIBES IN THE UNITED STATES, WITH A POPULATION OF JUST UNDER 400 AND A MAJORITY BEING OF HAIDA DESCENT. TODAY, MANY OF THE INDUSTRIES THAT ONCE PROVIDED VALUABLE JOBS TO HYDABURG RESIDENTSJOBS IN TIMBER AND COMMERCIAL FISHINGHAVE ALL BUT DISAPPEARED, RESULTING IN A SIGNIFICANT NEGATIVE IMPACT ON THE LOCAL ECONOMY. THE OUTLOOK REMAINS OPTIMISTIC, HOWEVER, FOR THERE IS A NEW OPPORTUNITY THAT SHOWS GREAT PROMISE: TOURISM. THE VISITOR INDUSTRY ON PRINCE OF WALESAN OTHERWISE REMOTE PART OF THE STATES FAMED INSIDE PASSAGE DUE TO ITS ABSENCE FROM ALASKA AIRLINES FLIGHT PATHS OR LARGE CRUISE SHIP ITINERARIESIS ALREADY PREPARING FOR POTENTIALLY RAPID EXPANSION FOLLOWING THE ANNOUNCEMENT THAT SMALL CRUISE VESSELS ARE ADDING THE COMMUNITY OF KLAWOCK TO THEIR MAY 2023 SAILING SCHEDULE, JUST 54 MILES BY ROAD FROM HYDABURG. WITH ALASKAS VISITOR INDUSTRY SEEKING NEW DESTINATIONS, AND AN EMERGING TOURISM MARKET LOOKING FOR MORE MEANINGFUL ECOTOURISM AND CULTURAL EXPERIENCES, HAIDA CORPORATION BELIEVES THAT THE TIME IS RIGHT TO EXPLORE THE FEASIBILITY OF PARTICIPATING IN ALASKAS TOURISM INDUSTRY. OBJECTIVEHAIDA CORPORATION SEES THE HYDABURG TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY AS THE KEY TO IDENTIFYING SUSTAINABLE WAYS TO GENERATE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND EMPLOYMENT FOR THE TOWN-S PEOPLE WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES TO PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND CREATE AWARENESS OF HAIDA CULTURE. WITH THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY OF HYDABURG NOW FULLY ENGAGED IN EXPLORING WAYS TO DEVELOP AN ENRICHING VISITOR EXPERIENCE, THE CHALLENGE OF SELECTING WHICH IDEAS TO PURSUE IS ENORMOUS. HAIDA CORPORATION CANNOT ACHIEVE ITS GOAL OF DEVELOPING A MASTER PLAN FOR TOURISM DEVELOPMENT WITHOUT THE SUPPORT AND EXPERTISE OF A FEASIBILITY TEAM.PROJECT TEAMTO EXECUTE THE HYDABURG TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY, HAIDA CORPORATION HAS SELECTED AN EXPERIENCED ALASKAN TEAM COMPOSED OF FOUR OF SOUTHEAST ALASKAS LEADING PLANNING FIRMS INCLUDING CORVUS DESIGN, PND ENGINEERS, RAIN COAST DATA, AND NORTHWIND ARCHITECTS (FEASIBILITY TEAM). TOGETHER, THIS TEAM OF LEADING EXPERT ARCHITECTS, MARINE AND CIVIL ENGINEERS, AND TOURISM ECONOMISTS WILL BRING THEIR VAST EXPERIENCE IN DEVELOPING CULTURAL PLANS FOR THE REGIONS COASTAL COMMUNITIES DIRECTLY INTO THE COMMUNITY OF HYDABURG TO WORK ALONGSIDE HAIDA CORPORATION AND ITS UNITED FRONT COLLABORATORS, COMPRISED OF HAIDA CORPORATION, THE VILLAGE TRIBE HAIDA COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION, THE CITY OF HYDABURG, AND THE HYDABURG CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT.TECHNICAL DESCRIPTIONTHE HYDABURG TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL PROVIDE A ROADMAP FOR HAIDA CORPORATION TO FOLLOW TOWARD ITS GOAL OF MINDFULLY DEVELOPING TOURISM IN A WAY THAT BOTH CELEBRATES AND PRESERVES HAIDA HERITAGE AND CULTURE WHILE PROVIDING VALUABLE JOB OPPORTUNITIES AND A SUSTAINABLE SOURCE OF INCOME FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE HYDABURG TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY CONSISTS OF FOUR PHASES COMPLETED BETWEEN JANUARY - DECEMBER 2023. THE RESULT IS A PREFERRED COMMUNITY TOURISM MASTER PLAN INFORMED BY COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS BETWEEN THE EXPERT FEASIBILITY TEAM, HAIDA CORPORATION, AND THE BROADER COMMUNITY OF HYDABURG. THE FINAL DELIVERABLE INCLUDES A PROPOSED MASTER PLAN COMMUNITY DESIGN COMPLETE WITH EXPERT DRAWINGS, EXPLANATORY NARRATIVES FOR EACH ELEMENT OF THE PLAN, CONSTRUCTION PROJECT ESTIMATES, DETAILED ECONOMIC BENEFIT ANALYSIS OF THE PLAN TO THE COMMUNITY OF HYDABURG, AND PHASING RECOMMENDATIONS.

THE PROPOSED ONEIDA INDIAN NATION TRIBAL TOURISM FEASIBILITY STUDY WILL EXPLORE THE POSSIBILITY OF ADDING MOTOCROSS TRACK FACILITIES TO NATION LANDS IN CENTRAL NEW YORK TO ATTRACT VISITORS AND DIVERSIFY REVENUE SOURCES. THE PROPOSED TRACK FACILITIES WILL PROVIDE A VENUE FOR PROFESSIONAL AND AMATEUR MOTOCROSS COMPETITIONS, YEAR ROUND PUBLIC USE AND RECREATION, AND MOTORCYCLE TRAINING ACTIVITIES. THE NATION PROPOSES TO HIRE MX TRACK BUILDERS, AN INDUSTRY LEADER IN THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF MOTOCROSS TRACKS, TO SERVE AS THE CONSULTANT FOR THE PROJECT. MX TRACK BUILDERS WILL CONDUCT A SITE VISIT AND THOROUGH SITE ANALYSIS BEFORE PRODUCING A WRITTEN FEASIBILITY STUDY, INCLUDING OPERATIONAL RECOMMENDATIONS, MARKET ANALYSIS, AND FINANCIAL DATA. THE PROPOSED TRACK FACILITIES WILL BENEFIT THE NATION BY PROVIDING A NEW NON GAMING REVENUE SOURCE AND DRAWING VISITORS TO NATION LANDS.

THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA (CNO) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBE THAT OVERSEES A 10,922 SQUARE MILE RESERVATION IN SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA, WHICH OVERLAYS 13 OKLAHOMA COUNTIES  ATOKA, BRYAN, CHOCTAW, COAL, HASKELL, HUGHES, JOHNSTON, LATIMER, LEFLORE, MCCURTAIN, PITTSBURG, PONTOTOC, AND PUSHMATAHA. CURRENTLY, THERE IS NO STRATEGY BASED BUSINESS PLAN IN PLACE FOR TOURISM ACROSS THE RESERVATION. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW FOR A CONTRACTED PLAN THAT WILL IDENTIFY KEY STAKEHOLDERS FOR THE FUTURE, INVENTORY CNOS EXISTING TOURISM SITES, PLAN FOR EVENTS AND ATTRACTIONS, AS WELL AS ESTABLISH A VISION FOR THE FUTURE OF THE NATIVE AMERICAN BASED TOURISM INDUSTRY IN SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA. ONE OF THE MOST VALUABLE ASSETS THAT SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA HAS TO OFFER IS ITS WIDE RANGE OF NATURAL SURROUNDINGS. DENSE FORESTS, RUGGED HILLS, AND PEACEFUL LAKES MAKE FOR A MYRIAD OF OPTIONS FOR TRAVELERS. DURING THE HEIGHT OF THE COVID 19 PANDEMIC MORE AND MORE PEOPLE WERE SEEKING TEMPORARY REFUGE AT CAMPING SITES AND REMOTE WILDERNESS LOCATIONS, TO AVOID THE CROWDS OF LARGER CITIES OR SHUTTERED ATTRACTIONS. IT IS OF PARAMOUNT IMPORTANCE TO THE CHOCTAW NATION THAT ANCESTRAL NATIVE AMERICAN SITES ARE PRESERVED AND RESPECTED BY VISITORS, SO THEIR EDUCATIONAL IMPACT CAN BE SHARED WITH GENERATIONS TO COME.FROM A TECHNICAL STANDPOINT, THE PLAN WILL INCLUDE IN DEPTH RESEARCH, IN PERSON SITE TOURS, TRAVELER DATA COLLECTION, PLANNED VISITS WITH LOCAL AND MUNICIPAL AUTHORITIES, AND GOAL PROJECTIONS. WITH THE COMPLETION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CHOCTAW COUNTRY DESTINATION MANAGEMENT PLAN, INCREASED TOURISM AND REVENUE STREAMS WITHIN THE RESERVATION CAN BE REALIZED AND BUILT UPON.

CCTTFSP WILL HIRE (1) CONSULTANT TO CONDUCT (1) TOURISM MARKET FEASIBILITY STUDY ON POTENTIAL TOURISM OPPORTUNITIES ON THE ROCKY BOYS INDIAN RESERVATION, THEREBY INCREASING TOURISM CAPACITY AND INFORMED DECISION MAKING, FOR THE DURATION OF THE 12 MONTH PROJECT PERIOD

THE DEPARTMENT OF TOURISM WITHIN THE CHICKASAW NATION DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE, AN EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE CHICKASAW NATION, OPERATES EXHIBIT C GALLERY IN THE BRICKTOWN DISTRICT OF OKLAHOMA CITY, OKLAHOMA. EXHIBIT C GALLERY WILL BE RELOCATING TO A NEW TOURISM DEVELOPMENT SITE IN OKLAHOMA CITY. THE NEW SITE IS ADJACENT TO THE FIRST AMERICANS MUSEUM (FAM), WHICH OPENED IN SEPTEMBER 2021, AND THE NEW OKANA RESORT AND WATERPARK, WHICH WILL OPEN IN EARLY 2025.EXHIBIT C GALLERY IS A FIRST AMERICAN RETAIL GALLERY THAT OPENED IN 2014 WITH THE MISSION OF SHOWCASING AND CELEBRATING FIRST AMERICAN ART TO THE MILLION PLUS VISITORS TO OKLAHOMA CITY EACH YEAR. EXHIBIT C GALLERY WILL BE RELOCATING FROM BRICKTOWN S 3,500 SQUARE FOOT LOCATION TO A NEW LOCATION ADJACENT TO FAM AND THE OKANA RESORT AND WATERPARK. THE NEW 10,000 SQUARE FOOT GALLERY WILL SHOWCASE FIRST AMERICAN ARTISTS TO THE ESTIMATED 630,000 GUESTS WHO WILL VISIT THE SITE ANNUALLY. A NEW ADDITION TO EXHIBIT C GALLERY UPON RELOCATION WILL BE UP TO SEVEN WORKING ARTIST STUDIOS, EXCLUSIVELY AVAILABLE TO FIRST AMERICAN ARTISTS WHO WISH TO RENT SPACE TO RESEARCH, DEVELOP AND CREATE THEIR ART IN AN INTEGRATED SPACE. THE STUDIOS ARE AN AMENITY TO THE GALLERY EXPERIENCE, GIVING GUESTS A GLIMPSE INTO THE ARTISTS  CREATIVE PROCESSES AND CREATING MOMENTS OF PERSONAL CONNECTION.EXHIBIT C GALLERY ENCOURAGES COLLABORATION AND CREATIVITY FOR GUESTS, ARTISTS AND EMPLOYEES. CLASSROOM SPACE IS INTEGRATED WITHIN EXHIBIT C GALLERY FOR ART CLASSES, ARTIST TALKS AND RECEPTIONS. AT LEAST THREE TIMES A YEAR, THE EXHIBIT C GALLERY HOSTS THEMED EXHIBITS, BRINGING TOGETHER WORKS OF VARIOUS MEDIUMS AND ARTISTS. THROUGH PUBLIC RELATIONS EFFORTS, THE EXHIBITS ARE SHOWCASED AND CELEBRATED NATIONALLY. ALL ARTWORK WITHIN THE EXHIBIT C GALLERY IS FOR SALE. IN ADDITION TO ART, THE GALLERY SELLS GIFT AND RETAIL ITEMS CREATED BY FIRST AMERICAN COMPANIES OR COMPANIES THAT PARTNER WITH FIRST AMERICAN TRIBES AND CITIZENS.THE CHICKASAW NATION DEPARTMENT OF TOURISM AND EXHIBIT C GALLERY HAVE SPENT THE LAST YEAR DESIGNING THE RELOCATED GALLERY BUILDING WITH THE HIRED ARCHITECTS AND SITE DEVELOPER, RECEIVING FEEDBACK ALONG THE WAY FROM CHICKASAW AND SOUTHEASTERN FIRST AMERICAN ARTISTS. BUILDING PLANNING IS ESSENTIAL FOR OPERATIONAL SUCCESS AND LOGISTICS. UPON RELOCATING, EXHIBIT C GALLERY MUST HAVE A STRONG BUSINESS PLAN TO OUTLINE OPERATIONAL AND STRATEGIC SUCCESS. WITH THE USE OF THE TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS, EXHIBIT C GALLERY WILL PARTNER WITH AEA CONSULTING, A GLOBAL CONSULTING FIRM THAT WORKS WITH CULTURAL AND ART ATTRACTIONS WORLDWIDE TO DEVELOP CUSTOM PLANS AND ROADMAPS FOR SUCCESS IN THE CULTURAL SECTOR. THIS PARTNERSHIP WILL ALLOW THE CHICKASAW NATION TO DEVELOP A BUSINESS PLAN TO ENSURE LOCAL, REGIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL TOURISM SUCCESS FOR THE GALLERY AND THE OVER 50 REPRESENTED FIRST AMERICAN ARTISTS.

THE BURNS PAIUTE TRIBE (BURNS PAIUTE OR THE TRIBE) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBELOCATED PRIMARILY IN HARNEY COUNTY, IN RURAL EASTERN OREGON. THE TRIBE OWNS SEVERAL DISTINCTPARCELS OF LAND AROUND THE CITY OF BURNS, INCLUDING OUR PRIMARY RESERVATION AS WELL ASOFF RESERVATION PROPERTY. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS TOURISM FOCUSED PROJECT TO EXPLORE THEPOTENTIAL FOR A DESTINATION RESORT FACILITY, ENTITLED FOLEY FIELD DESTINATION RESORT FEASIBILITYSTUDY AND BUSINESS PLAN, OUR PROPERTY AT FOLEY FIELD IS THE MOST RELEVANT PROPERTY. FOLEY FIELDCONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 100 ACRES OF LAND, APPROXIMATELY ONE THIRD OF WHICH LIE WITHIN THE CITYLIMITS OF BURNS, OREGON. FOLEY FIELD HAS DIRECT ACCESS TO HIGHWAY 121 AND IS UNIQUELY POSITIONEDJUST NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 20 (WHICH RUNS EAST WEST CONNECTING THE OREGON COASTTO BOISE, IDAHO) AND HIGHWAY 395 (WHICH RUNS NORTH SOUTH CONNECTING WASHINGTON, CALIFORNIA,AND NEVADA).WE BELIEVE THAT FOLEY FIELD HAS GREAT POTENTIAL AS A SITE FOR TOURISM ACTIVITY. OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS,ELECTED LEADERSHIP, AND ECONOMIC ADVISORS AGREE THAT, GIVEN OUR REMOTE LOCATION, THE OPTIMALTOURISM USE OF FOLEY FIELD MUST INVOLVE CREATING A SIGNIFICANT DESTINATION THAT WILL ATTRACT VISITORSFROM OUTSIDE THE LOCAL AREA, IDEALLY FOR MULTI DAY TRAVEL THAT WILL INVOLVE LODGING AND RECREATIONSPENDING.TAKING THIS INTO CONSIDERATION, OUR VISION FOR THE FOLEY FIELD SITE IS A RESORT CASINO SPADESTINATION  BOTH FOR THE ALMOST 100,000 VISITORS THAT OUR HOME AREA OF HARNEY COUNTYALREADY RECEIVES EACH YEAR, AND A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF ADDITIONAL VISITORS THAT WOULD BEATTRACTED BY THIS NEW DESTINATION, BENEFITTING BOTH THE TRIBE AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY.THE PROPOSED TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM (TTGP) STUDY WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO ASSESS THEVIABILITY OF THE RESORT CASINO SPA CONCEPT, TO DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE SCALE OF SUCH ADESTINATION AT FOLEY FIELD, TO IDENTIFY WHICH AMENITIES THE RESORT SHOULD OFFER, AND TO DEVELOP AFINANCIAL AND OPERATING PLAN THAT CAN BE EXECUTED TO BRING THE RESORT CONCEPT TO FRUITION.

PROJECT ABSTRACT NARRATIVE FOR BLACKFEET TOURISM BUSINESS PLANBIA TTGP 2022 OIED  TRIBAL TOURISM GRANT PROGRAM (TTGP)THE BLACKFEET MANPOWER TOURISM OFFICE WILL HIRE CONSULTANTS FROM OSIYO CONSULTANCY TO WRITE A BUSINESS PLAN TO BUILD A BLACKFEET HERITAGE VISITOR CENTER ON THE BLACKFEET RESERVATION IN MONTANA. ACCORDING TO THE 2020 TOURISM FEASIBILITY ASSESSMENT PRODUCED BY VIRGINIA TECH HOWARD FEIERTAG DEPARTMENT OF HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM MANAGEMENT THERE IS A HIGH RATE IN DATA THAT INDICATES AVID TO POTENTIAL VISITORS ARE INTERESTED IN VISITING A HERITAGE CENTER, TO PURCHASE NATIVE CRAFTS, EAT AND DINE AT NATIVE CUISINE SPOTS, EXPERIENCE SPECIAL NATIVE CULTURE FESTIVAL EVENTS, DEMONSTRATE LIVE CULTURAL PERFORMANCES (COOKING, ARTS, ETC.), HEAR ORAL TRADITIONAL HISTORY AND STORIES, IMMERSE IN EXPERIENCE OF POWWOWS, RODEO, AND INDIAN HORSE RELAYS, AND PARTICIPATE IN GUIDED EXPERIENCES. THE BLACKFEET HERITAGE VISITOR CENTER WOULD SERVE AS A TOURISM HUB FOR VISITORS TO FIND THEIR TRAVEL INTERESTS IN A ONE STOP PLACE. THE BUSINESS PLAN WILL BE GUIDED BY A TOURISM ADVISORY COMMITTEE TO BE ESTABLISHED DURING DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUSINESS PLAN. THE COMMITTEE WILL HELP DETERMINE HOW THE HERITAGE CENTER WILL BE PURPOSED AND DESIGNED, WHO IT WILL SERVE, HOW IT WILL BE MARKETED, WHAT AMENITIES IT WILL OFFER, AND HOW IT WILL BEST SERVE OUR COMMUNITY AS A TOURISM HUB. THE BUSINESS PLAN WILL ALSO ESTABLISH NEXT STEPS FOR FUNDING AND BUILDING THE CENTER AS AN ECONOMIC GENERATOR FOR THE BLACKFEET NATION.

THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY (BMIC OR TRIBE) IS INTERESTED IN PERFORMING A FEASIBILITY STUDY TO ASSESS TOURISM DIVERSIFICATION OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN OUR AREA.  BMIC HAS APPLIED FOR FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT PREVIOUSLY.  HOWEVER, IT WAS NOT FUNDED, AND NO SUCH STUDY HAS BEEN COMPLETED. A TEAM OF KEY STAFF FROM BMIC WILL SEEK AND USE CONSULTANT INPUT TO DETERMINE THE POSSIBILITY OF DEVELOPING TOURISM DIVERSIFICATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY.  A CONSULTANT WILL LOOK AT THE DEVELOPMENTAL OPPORTUNITIES, FOLLOWED BY TECHNICAL ANALYSIS TO ASSESS THE PROJECTS OVERALL FEASIBILITY.  SHOULD ANY OPPORTUNITIES BE DEEMED FEASIBLE THROUGH THE PROJECT, THE FINAL REPORT MAY CONTAIN A ROADMAP FROM THE EXECUTION AND ASSIST IN POSITIONING BMIC TO PURSUE FURTHER FUNDING FOR THE BUSINESS PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE ALABAMA COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS (ACTT) PROPOSES THE PLANNING AND PRIORITIZATION OF TOURISM FOR THE ALABAMA COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS (ACTT) PROJECT AS A TOURISM ASSESSMENT, FEASIBILITY, AND PLANNING PROJECT TO FOCUS AND PRIORITIZE DEVELOPMENT OF TRIBAL TOURISM ASSETS OWNED BY, OPERATED BY, OR AFFILIATED WITH THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS FOR THE DISTINCT PURPOSE OF ENHANCING THE OVERALL ECONOMIC RESILIENCE OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY IN POLK COUNTY, TEXAS. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THREE DISTINCT PHASES, EACH WITH A DISTINGUISHABLE OBJECTIVE AND DELIVERABLE, A TOURISM DEVELOPMENT ASSESSMENT, FEASIBILITY STUDY AND BUSINESS IMPLEMENTATION PLAN. THE COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH WILL EXPLORE THE ASSETS AND OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE AND CULMINATE IN A PLAN TO IMPLEMENT THE MOST FEASIBLE STRATEGIES IDENTIFIED THROUGH THE EXPLORATION PROCESS. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS THE TRIBES EFFORTS TO BECOME A TOURISM DESTINATION AND SUSTAIN THE CULTURE AND HERITAGE OF THE PEOPLE OF THE ALABAMA COUSHATTA TRIBE OF TEXAS.

MEMBERS AND OTHER AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKA NATIVE  AI AN  INDIVIDUALS THROUGHOUT THE SERVICE AREA IN WESTERN WASHINGTON, WHICH SERVES MULTIPLE RESERVATIONS WITHIN EIGHT COUNTIES  SPIPA IS AN ELIGIBLE APPLICANT FOR THE INDIAN BUSINESS INCUBATORS PROGRAM  IBIP  AND WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR A BUSINESS INCUBATOR IN THE CITY OF TUMWATER  THIS SPACE WILL ALLOW NATIVE AMERICAN SMALL BUSINESSES AND NATIVE AMERICAN ENTREPRENEURS TO HAVE ACCESS TO WORKSPACE, A COMPUTER LAB, WORKSHOPS AND NETWORKING EVENTS, AS WELL AS RESOURCES SUCH AS OFFICE SUPPLIES AND TECHNOLOGY, SUCH AS A COPIER FOR MAKING FLYERS AND BROCHURES  IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR FULL INCUBATOR SUPPORT, PARTICIPANTS MUST COMPLETE SPIPAS RIGOROUS NATIVE ENTREPRENEURSHIP ACADEMY  GRANT FUNDS TRAIN PARTICIPANTS, COLLABORATE WITH EXISTING ENTREPRENEURSHIP RESOURCES, AND BECOME A HUB OF SMALL BUSINESS SERVICES THAT CATER TO THE FIVE CONSORTIUM TRIBES AND EIGHT COUNTIES THAT SPIPA SERVES  IN THE CHICKASAW NATION BUSINESS NETWORK  CNBN  PRESENTS A PROPOSAL FOR THE INDIAN BUSINESS INCUBATORS PROGRAM  IBIP  GRANT  THE CNBN WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO OPEN A STOREFRONT THAT WILL HOUSE A NATIVE BUSINESS INCUBATOR HUB, THE KELELI BUSINESS CENTER  KBC , TO BE LOCATED IN ADA, OKLAHOMA, THAT WILL ASSIST FIRST AMERICAN START UPS AND EXISTING BUSINESSES TO SUCCEED BY PROVIDING CULTURALLY TAILORED INCUBATION SERVICES, WORKSPACES, FINANCIAL GUIDANCE, MENTORING AND TRAINING  THE PROPOSED FORMAL NAME OF THE HUB IS UNDER LEADERSHIP REVIEW  THE CHICKASAW WORD, KELELI, MEANS TO IGNITE, APPROPRIATE FOR THE KBC MISSION, TO IGNITE THE WARRIOR SPIRIT THAT ENCOURAGES ALL FIRST AMERICAN ENTREPRENEURS THE DRIVE TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN THEIR BUSINESS ENDEAVORS  THE GRANT WILL CREATE THE OPPORTUNITY TO DIVERSIFY THE RURAL REGIONAL ECONOMY BY INCREASING THE NUMBER OF FIRST AMERICAN SCALABLE START UP COMPANIES LOCAL TO ADA AND RURAL SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA       GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE TECHNOLOGY STATIONS WITH COMPUTERS, ANY SOFTWARE REQUIRED, PRINTER AND OTHER OFFICE FURNITURE AND SUPPLIES NECESSARY TO ENSURE AN ATMOSPHERE AND WORKSPACE THAT SUPPORTS AND ENCOURAGES MENTORING, LEARNING, NETWORKING, EXCHANGING OF IDEAS AND EXPERIENCES AND AN OVERALL PRODUCTIVE EXPERIENCE FOR FIRST AMERICAN START UPS  MENTORING, ADVISING AND TRAINING ARE MAJOR COMPONENTS OF AN INCUBATOR PROGRAM, THEREFORE, THE CNBN WILL CONTRACT FIRST AMERICAN ENTREPRENEURS, WHOSE BUSINESS PRIMARILY FOCUSES ON CONSULTING AND SMALL BUSINESS, TO FULFILL THIS ROLE  IN ADDITION, SPECIALIZED INSTRUCTION, SUCH AS QUICKBOOKS, AND ONLINE TRAINING SITES WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE KBC IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THE ADDITIONAL WORKLOAD CNBN WILL NEED TO HIRE A BUSINESS ADVISOR, OR SMALL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT SERVICES LIAISON, WHOSE SALARY WILL BE COVERED BY GRANT FUNDS AND WILL OFFICE OUT OF THE INCUBATOR

THE LUMMI INDIAN BUSINESS COUNCIL IS SEEKING FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM THE LIVING LANGUAGES PROGRAM FUNDING ANNOUNCED AS A DISCRETIONARY GRANT FROM THE BUREAU INDIAN AFFAIRS, FOR THE PERIOD OF 12-MONTHS IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,000 FOR THE FY22-23 EXPECTED TO START APRIL 18, 2022 AND EXPIRE APRIL 17, 2023. THE LUMMI NATION IS PREPARED TO ADJUST THE PROJECT TIMELINE AFTER WE RECEIVE NOTICE OF AWARD. OUR PROJECT GOAL PROPOSES TO INCREASE PRESERVATION AND ACCESS OF XWLEMI CHOSEN TO THE LUMMI COMMUNITY AND ITS STUDENTS, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME BUILDING THE CAPACITY FOR OUR CURRENT CERTIFIED LANGUAGE TEACHERS. WE BELIEVE BY THIS INVESTMENT AND OUR GOAL WE WILL INCREASE OUR KNOWLEDGE OF TRIBAL IDENTITY AND OUR SENSE OF BELONGING WITH OUR NEXT GENERATION OF LANGUAGE LEARNERS/SPEAKERS/TEACHERS.WE UNDERSTAND OUR ANCESTRAL LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL-WELLBEING AS THE FIRST MAJOR STEP TOWARDS REVITALIZING THE LANGUAGE. THE LUMMI SCHELANGEN DIVISION HAS SPONSORED THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE LUMMI LANGUAGE PROGRAM. FOR THIS PROPOSAL WE WILL SERVE OUR STUDENTS THAT ARE A PART OF THE LUMMI COMMUNITY, BUT PRIMARILY THOSE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 7-18YEARS OLDS WHO ATTEND THE FERNDALE SCHOOL DISTRICT. BY THE END OF THE GRANT PROJECT WE HAVE DETERMINED THAT OUR OVERALL OUTCOME WILL BE READILY AVAILABLE RESOURCES IN DIGITAL FORMAT, INCREASE IN CLASSROOM MANAGEMENT TRAINING TO COMPLEMENT DISTANT LEARNING PRACTICES.

PROJECT ABSTRACT KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITYLIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROPOALOJIBWE LANGUAGE EDUCATION AND APPRENTICESHIP PROJECTKEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY (KBIC) PROPOSES TO START AN OJIBWE LANGUAGE APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM TO BUILD OUR CAPACITY TO PRESERVE OUR FIRST LANGUAGE THAT HAS LOST ALMOST ALL OF ITS USERS. OUR CURRENT, CONTRACTED, OJIBWE LANGUAGE INSTRUCTOR WILL TRAIN, TEACH AND MENTOR A KBIC TRIBAL MEMBER LANGUAGE APPRENTICE TO BECOME A FLUENT SPEAKER OF OJIBWE. THE APPRENTICE CAN THEN TEACH YOUTH, FAMILIES WITH YOUNG CHILDREN, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS OUR FIRST LANGUAGE AND THE CULTURAL PRACTICES OF OUR ANCESTORS.KBIC IS THE OLDEST AND LARGEST FEDERALLY-RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE IN MICHIGAN, (KBIC 1936) COMPRISED OF MORE THAN 3000 TRIBAL MEMBERS AND SEVERAL DESCENDANTS, WITH OVER 1000 RESIDING WITHIN THE APPROXIMATELY 59,000 ACRES OF THE LANSE RESERVATION, LOCATED IN THE FAR NORTH OF THE UPPER PENINSULA OF MI ON THE SHORE OF LAKE SUPERIOR. LIKE MANY TRIBAL COMMUNITIES, THE KBIC HAS NO FLUENT OJIBWE SPEAKERS REMAINING. AS SUCH, THE KBIC CURRENTLY CONTRACTS A LANGUAGE INSTRUCTOR FROM AN OZAWA TRIBE IN CANADA. WITH THE CONTRACTING OF THIS LANGUAGE INSTRUCTOR, KBIC CURRENTLY CAN OFFER SOME HIGH SCHOOL LEVEL LANGUAGE CLASSES AND, HOPEFULLY, SOME WORKSHOPS FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY. THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE EDUCATION AND APPRENTICESHIP PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH TWO LARGE GOALS IN THE ABILITY TO PRESERVE THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE IN THE KBIC FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE EDUCATION AND APPRENTICESHIP PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO DEVELOP AN APPRENTICE TO BECOME A FLUENT LANGUAGE INSTRUCTOR. THE OUTCOME OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE APPRENTICE WILL BE THAT KBIC WILL HAVE A LONG-TERM LANGUAGE AND CULTURE INSTRUCTOR WHO HAS LIVED EXPERIENCES OF THE LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL CEREMONIES PRACTICED BY OUR ANCESTORS ON THIS LAND. YOUTH, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL STAND IN THE VERY SPOTS ON MOTHER EARTH WHERE THEIR ANCESTORS STOOD TO HEAR THEIR STORIES SPOKEN IN OJIBWE WHILE PRACTICING CULTURAL SKILLS SUCH AS WEAVING RICE BASKETS AND CARVING KNOCKERS. WITH THE ADDITION OF A LANGUAGE APPRENTICE, CURRENT LANGUAGE EDUCATION CAN BE EXPANDED, REACHING THE YOUNGEST OF OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS. OFFERING PUBLIC SCHOOL CLASSES IN THE TWO DISTRICTS LOCATED ON AND NEAR THE LANSE RESERVATION; AND LANGUAGE AND CULTURE IMMERSION EXPERIENCES WITH TRIPS TO EXPERIENCE THE NATIVE AMERICAN CULTURE ON A NATIONAL LEVEL; WILL EXCITE YOUNG GENERATIONS OF KEWEENAW BAY TRIBAL MEMBERS TO BE COMMITTED TO LEARNING AND USING  THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL PRACTICES. NEW GENERATIONS OF OJIBWE SPEAKERS WILL BE CREATED.

THERE ARE ONLY EIGHT REMAINING FLUENT SPEAKERS OF KASHIA, ALL ELDERS IN OUR TRIBE LOCATED IN RURAL NORTHERN CALIFORNIA.  CLEARLY, TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE TO RECORD AND FORMALIZE A COMPREHENSIVE, AUTHORITATIVE DICTIONARY AND DEVELOP MECHANISMS FOR BROADER TRANSFER OF KNOWLEDGE TO THE ENTIRE KASHIA TRIBAL COMMUNITY, WHICH WILL BE THE FOCUS OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT ENTITLED ESTABLISHING COMPREHENSIVE KASHIA LANGUAGE FOUNDATIONS.  WE WILL BUILD A DICTIONARY THAT WILL SERVE AS THE FOUNDATION FOR OUR KASHIA LANGUAGE PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION IN THE COMING YEARS.  WE WILL ALSO DEVELOP A VOCABULARY BUILDER APP THAT OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THEIR FAMILIES CAN USE TO LEARN THE KASHIA LANGUAGE.  FINALLY, WE WILL INVEST THE TIME AND ENERGY REQUIRED TO TRACK DOWN AND RECOVER DOCUMENTS AND RESOURCES IN THE KASHIA LANGUAGE WHICH ARE CURRENTLY IN THE POSSESSION OF LIBRARIES AT UNIVERSITIES AND MUNICIPALITIES AROUND CALIFORNIA AND ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE COUNTRY; BRINGING THESE RESOURCES HOME TO KASHIA WILL SERVE AS ANOTHER IMPORTANT FOUNDATION FOR A REVITALIZED FUTURE OF OUR LANGUAGE.

WITH OVERSIGHT FROM FCPCS CULTURAL PRESERVATION DIVISION STAFF, AS WELL AS ASSISTANCE FROM LEADERSHIP IN THE TRIBES PRESCHOOL, THE TRIBE SEEKS FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $155,717.62 TO CONTINUE ITS BODWWADMI LANGUAGE IMMERSION EFFORTS. THE TRIBE ANTICIPATES THAT 125 TRIBAL YOUTH, AGES 0-7, WILL BE IMPACTED EACH YEAR BY THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS LANGUAGE CURRICULUM AND SUBSEQUENT COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS.
