THE NAVAJO LANGUAGE DOCUMENTATION AND DAILY LIFE PROGRAM IS A SMALL START-UP PROGRAM THAT WILL BUILD NAVAJO LANGUAGE CAPACITY THROUGH THE PRESERVATION OF CEREMONIAL LANGUAGE AND THE EXPLORATION OF EVERYDAY EXPERIENCE. CEREMONIAL LANGUAGE WILL BE PRESERVED BY DOCUMENTING SITE VISITS TO THE HOMES OF MEDICINE MEN, AS WELL AS SPECIAL GATHERINGS THAT CONVENE MEDICINE MEN TOGETHER. THE DIN SOVEREIGNTY INSTITUTE WILL CONVENE MEDICINE MEN FROM ACROSS NAVAJO NATION AND HOST TWO GATHERINGS AT DIN COLLEGES MAIN CAMPUS IN TSAILE, ARIZONA, LOCATED IN THE HEART OF NAVAJO NATION. A VIDEOGRAPHER AND PROGRAM STAFF WILL DOCUMENT AND RECORD WHAT IS LEARNED AT THE GATHERINGS. IN ADDITION, PROGRAM STAFF WILL MAKE SITE VISITS TO LEARN FROM MEDICINE MEN IN THE SPECIFIC CONTEXT OF WHERE THEY LIVE. THIS IS BECAUSE MANY LINGUISTIC AND CEREMONIAL PRACTICES ARE PLACE-BASED, AND INFORMED BY THE HOMES AND IMMEDIATE ENVIRONS OF THE MEDICINE MEN. THE DOCUMENTATION OF THE GATHERINGS AND SITE VISITS WILL RESULT IN THE PRODUCTION OF ELECTRONIC AND PRINT MEDIA. THE DOCUMENTARY RECORD WILL BE A RESOURCE THAT ENHANCES THE UNDERSTANDING OF CEREMONIAL LANGUAGE, AND WILL INCLUDE DESCRIPTIONS OF THE PHYSICAL EXPRESSIONS AND MENTAL STATES THAT ATTEND CEREMONIAL LANGUAGE USE. MEDIA PRODUCED WILL BE A RESOURCE FOR LANGUAGE CAPACITY BUILDING, AND HAVE MANY USES THAT INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, INCREASING THE NUMBER AND PROFICIENCY OF SPEAKERS, ENHANCING CURRICULA, AND IMPROVING THE MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE DIN PEOPLE. THE NAVAJO LANGUAGE WILL BE REVITALIZED THROUGH A SERIES OF NAVAJO-ONLY PODCASTS THAT INVITE PEOPLE TO SHARE HOW THEY ARE ADAPTING AND TRANSFORMING NAVAJO LANGUAGE TO DESCRIBE AND DEAL WITH THE WORLD TODAY. THESE PODCASTS WILL BE BROADCAST ACROSS NAVAJO NATION, AND WE EXPECT THIS FORMAT TO BE POPULAR AMONG ALL GENERATIONS. THE COLLEGE WILL ARCHIVE THE PODCAST FOR USE BY THE COMMUNITY AND RESEARCHERS.

DELAWARE NATION LENAPE IS A LANGUAGE IN GRAVE DANGER.  WITH ONLY A HANDFUL OF SEMI-FLUENT CONVERSATIONAL SPEAKERS REMAINING, AND PERHAPS NO TRULY FLUENT INDIVIDUALS AT ALL, THE LANGUAGE RISKS COMPLETE DORMANCY WITHIN A FEW YEARS IF CONCRETE STEPS ARE NOT TAKEN TO SOLIDIFY THE FOUNDATION OF LANGUAGE LEARNING MATERIALS AND ENGAGE TODAYS DELAWARE NATION CITIZENS IN LEARNING AND USING THEIR LANGUAGE.  TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL OF REVERSING LANGUAGE LOSS AND BEGINNING THE PROCESS OF GROWING OUR LANGUAGE ONCE AGAIN, THE PROPOSED INITIATING SUSTAINABLE DELAWARE NATION LENAPE LANGUAGE REAWAKENING PROJECT WILL INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING ELEMENTS: (1) DEVELOP A 5-YEAR DELAWARE NATION LENAPE LANGUAGE REAWAKENING STRATEGIC PLAN; (2)  CREATE A NEW DELAWARE NATION LENAPE DICTIONARY DATABASE; (3) PREPARE PHONOLOGY AND ORTHOGRAPHY GUIDES FOR DELAWARE NATION LENAPE; AND (4) PUBLISH PUBLIC-FACING DELAWARE NATION LENAPE RESOURCES SUCH AS COLORING BOOKS AND PICTURE STORYBOOKS.

TAKELMA LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION/ PRESERVATION BY THE LANGUAGE PROGRAM OF THE COW CREEK BAND OF THE UMPQUA TRIBE OF INDIANS.  EFFORTS INCLUDE THE CONTINUED TRIBAL COMMUNITY BASED LESSONS, OUTREACH AT TRIBAL COMMUNITY EVENTS, AND THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF CONTEMPORARY WORDS FOR A CONTEMPORARY TRIBE.

THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE UMATILLA INDIAN RESERVATION LANGUAGE PROGRAM WILL USE THE FUNDS PROVIDED BY THE LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT TO FULFILL THE OBJECTIVE OF CONTINUING AND EXPANDING UPON OUR UMATILLA LANGUAGE IMMERSION PRESCHOOL, AS WELL AS CREATING A CURRICULUM AND TEACHING MATERIALS THAT CAN BE USED TO TEACH CHILDREN THE LANGUAGE FOR YEARS TO COME. THIS IS A PART OF OUR LONG-TERM GOAL TO REVITALIZE UMATILLA, A CRITICALLY ENDANGERED LANGUAGE WITH JUST THREE FIRST-LANGUAGE SPEAKERS REMAINING ON THE RESERVATION.OUR LANGUAGE IMMERSION PRESCHOOL OFFERS FOUR HOURS OF CLASS TIME A DAY, WITH MULTIPLE SHORT BREAKS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE LANGUAGE INPUT IS DESIGNED TO BE 50% IN UMATILLA AND 50% IN ENGLISH, LOOSELY FOLLOWING A ONE-PERSON-ONE-LANGUAGE SYSTEM, WHERE EACH MEMBER OF THE TEACHING TEAM USES ONE LANGUAGE, TO ENCOURAGE CHILDREN TO PUSH THEMSELVES TO COMMUNICATE IN THE TARGET LANGUAGE WITH THE INSTRUCTOR WHO DOES NOT SPEAK ENGLISH. WE ARE ABLE TO OFFER THESE CLASSES TO UP TO SEVEN CHILDREN AT A TIME, WITH CLASSES BEING HELD IN THE IMMERSION ROOM IN THE NIXYAAWI EDUCATION CENTER.  THE CURRICULUM, WHICH THE LANGUAGE PROGRAM IS DEVELOPING WITH A PENDLETON SCHOOL DISTRICT TEACHER WHO SPECIALIZES IN NATIVE LANGUAGES, FOCUSES ON TEACHING THE CHILDREN COMMON CLASSROOM COMMANDS, BASIC VOCABULARY, SONGS, AND CULTURAL KNOWLEDGE. THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE CONTENT IS FOCUSED ON GETTING THE STUDENTS KINDERGARTEN-READY. AS WE FURTHER DEVELOP THE CURRICULUM, WE WILL BE GUIDED BY THE PLAYWAY METHOD, WHERE CHILDREN LEARN BY ENGAGING IN PLAY AND ACTIVITIES. THIS APPEALS TO CHILDRENS NATURAL DESIRE TO PLAY WHILE TEACHING THEM AGE-APPROPRIATE SKILLS AND WORDS. THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, WE WILL ALSO OFFER LANGUAGE CLASSES TO THE STUDENTS PARENTS OR GUARDIANS, WHO SIGN AN AGREEMENT TO SPEND AT LEAST EIGHT HOURS A MONTH STUDYING THE LANGUAGE IN ORDER TO USE IT AT HOME TO REINFORCE LANGUAGE LEARNING. THEREFORE, PARENTS WILL LEARN THE SAME VOCABULARY AS THEIR CHILDREN. PARENTS WILL ALSO LEARN PHRASES TO USE AROUND THE HOME THAT THEY CAN USE AS A FAMILY. THE CHILDRENS LANGUAGE LEARNING PROGRESS WILL BE EVALUATED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THIS WILL BE DONE BY AN APPRENTICE OR OTHER LANGUAGE PROGRAM STAFF WHO TESTS EACH STUDENTS KNOWLEDGE OF VOCABULARY AND UNDERSTANDING COMMON UMATILLA CLASSROOM PHRASES. VOCABULARY WILL BE TESTED THROUGH IDENTIFICATION (WHAT IS THIS CALLED?) AND LABELING (WHICH ONE IS THE YAAMAS (DEER)?) TASKS. TO TEST THE STUDENTS UNDERSTANDING OF UMATILLA CLASSROOM PHRASES, WE WILL ASK THEM TO PLAY-ACT WITH A PUPPET, TO MINIMIZE FEELINGS OF SHYNESS. THE STUDENTS WILL TRANSLATE, THROUGH THE PUPPET, WHAT THE PHRASE MEANS TO ANOTHER PUPPET WHO IS A NEW STUDENT IN THE CLASS AND DOESNT UNDERSTAND. THE RESULTS OF THESE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE TRACKED AND WILL US TO IDENTIFY STRENGTHS AND AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT IN OUR CURRICULUM AND LESSON PLANS. WITH THE EXPERIENCE OF THIS GRANT-FUNDED YEAR OF CONTINUING THE UMATILLA LANGUAGE IMMERSION PRESCHOOL, WE WILL WRITE A REPORT OF OUR FINDINGS AS A POSSIBLE STARTING-POINT FOR OTHER TRIBES WISHING TO IMPLEMENT A SIMILAR PROGRAM. WE WILL CONTINUE TO IMPROVE AND REUSE THE CURRICULUM AND LESSON PLANS WE DEVELOP AND PLAN TO EXPAND THE IMMERSION PRESCHOOL PROGRAM TO SERVE MORE STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.

THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON EXPANDING THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF COOS, LOW UMPQUA, AND SIUSLAW INDIANS (CTCLUSI OR TRIBE) CAPACITY AND ABILITY TO REVITALIZE OUR THREE TRIBAL LANGUAGES; MILUK, HANIS AND SHAYUUSHTA U QUUIICH AND REINTEGRATE THEM INTO THE DAILY LIVES OF TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE KEY ELEMENT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SECURE THE GENERATIONAL TRANSFERENCE OF OUR THREE DISTINCT TRIBAL LANGUAGES. THIS WILL BE DONE TO SATISFY THE FOLLOWING PRINCIPLES;1)THE CTCLUSI LANGUAGE TEACHERS, LANGUAGE AND CULTURE COMMITTEE WILL LEAD THE DEVELOPMENT OF THEIR ORAL TRADITIONAL PROTOCOLS AS IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMUNITY; 2) POPULATING A LANGUAGE REPOSITORY WITH THE CTCLUSI CONTEMPORARY AND HISTORICAL LANGUAGE SOURCES AND 3) PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY TANGIBLE PUBLICATIONS IN THE LANGUAGE TO DISTRIBUTE TO THE THREE LANGUAGE COMMUNITIES, RESPECTIVELY. OUR CLASSES ARE OPEN TO OUR TRIBAL CITIZENS OF CTCLUSI, AND TO OUR RELATIVES FROM THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF SILETZ INDIANS (CTSI) AND COQUILLE INDIAN TRIBE (CIT), RESPECTIVELY.  HOWEVER, THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE 1,312 ENROLLED CTCLUSI TRIBAL MEMBERS.THE OVERALL PROJECT GOAL IS TO DEVELOP AND REFINE OUR TRIBES LANGUAGE REPOSITORY AND MAKE OUR THREE DISTINCT TRIBAL LANGUAGES ACCESSIBLE AND SEARCHABLE FOR OUR TRIBAL TEACHERS AND INTERESTED TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE LONG-TIME COMMUNITY GOALS ARE TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO TRIBAL LANGUAGES TO SUPPORT SPEAKERS PREVALENT THROUGHOUT THE DAILY ACTIVITIES AND ACTIONS OF OUR TRIBAL FAMILIES; THUS INCREASING THE LANGUAGE VISIBILITY FOR THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE. TRANSFERRING LANGUAGE TO OUR FUTURE GENERATIONS THROUGH YOUTH AND ELDER CONNECTIONS FOR TEACHING AND CULTURAL SHARING ARE FUNDAMENTAL TO OUR GROWTH IN EFFECTIVE TRANSFERENCE OF OUR LANGUAGES. WE WANT INTERGENERATIONAL TRANSFERENCE AND USE OF OUR TRIBAL LANGUAGES NORMALIZED, AND TO CONTINUE TO GROW THROUGHOUT OUR COMMUNITY, FAMILY AND ALL ASPECTS OF OUR LANGUAGE COMMUNITYS DAILY LIVES. SPECIFIC FOCUS IS PLACED ON IN-HOME USE OF LANGUAGE BETWEEN GRANDPARENTS, PARENTS AND CHILDREN. PRESERVING AND NORMALIZING THE LIFE AND USE OF OUR TRIBAL LANGUAGES: MILUK, HANIS AND SHAYUUSHTA U QUUIICH COOS, LOWER UMPQUA, AND SIUSLAW, OUR TEACHERS BUILD THEIR LESSONS BY REVITALIZING ORAL TRADITION THROUGH LIVING DATABASES, DICTIONARIES AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS. THE FOLLOWING THREE OBJECTIVES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED SIMULTANEOUSLY OVER THE 24-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD ARE:1:THE CTCLUSI LANGUAGE TEACHERS WILL LEAD THE DEVELOPMENT OF ORAL TRADITION PROTOCOLS FOR LANGUAGE CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT TO MEET OUR COMMUNITYS LANGUAGE NEEDS AND INTERESTS THAT WERE IDENTIFIED IN THE LANGUAGE NEEDS ASSESSMENT COMPLETED INTERNALLY, IN JUNE 2021.2:BUILD CAPACITY TOWARD THE CONTINUED DIGITAL TRANSCRIPTION OF OUR THREE TRIBAL LANGUAGES INTO THE ONLINE INDIGENOUS LANGUAGE DIGITAL ARCHIVE (ILDA), BY FUNDING TRANSCRIBERS, AND THE SPECIFIC TRAINING NEEDED FOR LANGUAGE TRANSCRIPTION OF MILUK, HANIS AND SHAYUUSHTA U QUUIICH. 3:PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY LANGUAGE KITS MATERIALS COMPILED IN DISTINCT LANGUAGE FOR EACH OF OUR THREE LANGUAGES RESPECTIVELY; INCLUDING BOOKS, GAMES, CALENDARS, LABELS AND MODELS THAT WILL SUPPORT THE CURRENT TRANSFER OF THE LANGUAGE THROUGH ONLINE MEETINGS. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES INCLUDE; 1)DEVELOP AN INCREASED CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT A LANGUAGE EDUCATION PROGRAM THAT MEETS THE NEEDS AND INTERESTS OF LANGUAGE LEARNERS IDENTIFIED BY THE LANGUAGE NEEDS ASSESSMENT CONDUCTED IN 2021 2)DEVELOP AN INCREASED CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT A LANGUAGE TEACHING PROGRAM AND INCREASED COMMUNITY MEMBER USE OF LANGUAGE LEARNING RESOURCES THAT ARE ACCESSIBLE AND APPROACHABLE 3)INCREASE THE NUMBER OF LANGUAGE LEARNERS AND STRENGTHEN PROFICIENCY AND USE BY LANGUAGE SPEAKERS AS WELL AS MAKING LANGUAGE MORE VISIBLE THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL ORGANIZATION.

COMANCHE NATION LANGUAGE DEPARTMENT (CNLD) WILL UTILIZE THE LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING, IF AWARDED, TO EXPAND UPON ITS EXISTING CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT IN AN EFFORT TO INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESS TO QUALITY LANGUAGE-LEARNING CONTENT. THIS WILL INVOLVE EXPANDING EXISTING CURRICULUM AND WRITING NEW CURRICULUM, USING ARCHIVAL AUDIO AND VIDEO RECORDINGS, AND MINIMAL NEW RECORDINGS TO CREATE FIVE UNITS OF ~ 10 LESSON SETS EACH ON THE TRANSPARENT LANGUAGE ONLINE PLATFORM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NON-PROFIT, 7000 LANGUAGES IN ORDER TO CREATE A SEQUENTIAL, DEVELOPMENTALLY-APPROPRIATE COMANCHE LEVEL 1 ONLINE COURSE. CREATED IN 2019, THE MISSION OF THE COMANCHE NATION LANGUAGE DEPARTMENT IS TO REVITALIZE AND RECLAIM THE COMANCHE LANGUAGE AND TO HELP OUR PEOPLE SPEAK AND THINK IN COMANCHE IN OUR OWN UNIQUE WAYS. REVITALIZING AND RECLAIMING OUR LANGUAGE IS CRITICAL TO COMANCHE NATIONS MISSION FOR ITS CITIZENS, AS THE COMANCHE LANGUAGE IS INTRINSICALLY INTERWOVEN WITH OUR CULTURE AND HISTORY AS A PEOPLE. THE COMANCHE NATION HAS SEEN A SHARP DECLINE IN COMANCHE LANGUAGE SPEAKERS AND HAS SEEN LITTLE TO NO DEVELOPMENT OF EMERGENT SPEAKERS DUE TO A LACK OF INTERGENERATION TRANSMISSION OF THE LANGUAGE AS WELL AS A LACK OF DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE, SEQUENTIAL INSTRUCTION IN COMANCHE DUE TO THE FACT THAT OUR LANGUAGE IS STILL NOT WELL DOCUMENTED. WE WANT TO ADDRESS THE TWO GAPS IN TRANSMISSION BETWEEN THE CHILD AND GRANDPARENT GENERATIONS WITH LANGUAGE PROGRAMMING THAT TARGETS BOTH ADOLESCENTS AND PARENT-AGED ADULTS SIMULTANEOUSLY. THE COMANCHE NATION LANGUAGE DEPARTMENT WILL UTILIZE THE LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING TO EXPAND UPON ITS PREVIOUS SUCCESS WITH ONLINE LEARNING VIA MEMRISE AND VIDEOS ON OUR SOCIAL MEDIA CHANNELS BY CREATING AN ONLINE COURSE IN THE TRANSPARENT LANGUAGE ONLINE PLATFORM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NON-PROFIT, 7000 LANGUAGES, THAT WILL MAKE UP THE FIRST EVER COMANCHE LEVEL 1 INTERACTIVE COURSE THAT WILL ACCESSIBLE FROM ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, A COMPLETE COMANCHE LEVEL I ONLINE COURSE OF 5 UNITS (~10 LESSONS SETS/UNIT) WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR USE.

ABSTRACT AMONG THE OJIBWE AND NEIYO OF THE ROCKY BOYS INDIAN RESERVATION, RAPID LANGUAGE LOSS CONTINUES TO PROGRESS AT AN ALARMING RATE. THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE IS IN A HEIGHTENED STATE OF PERIL AS THE NUMBER OF ORIGINAL OJIBWE SPEAKERS HAS DWINDLED TO ZERO SPEAKERS. IN AN EFFORT TO HELP CURB THIS NATION ENDING  TREND THE CHIPPEWA CREE CULTURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT / DEPARTMENT OF INDIAN EDUCATION IS FULLY PURSUING A TRIBALLY DRIVEN EFFORT TO ESTABLISH A LONG TERM OJIBWE NEIYO LANGUAGE IMMERSION INITIATIVE. IT IS OUR INTENT TO GAIN SUPPORT THROUGH THE LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROGRAM TO FURTHER THIS HIGH PRIORITY TRIBAL TRIBAL LANGUAGE PRESERVATION INITIATIVE.

THE CHICKASAW NATION (CN) IS PROPOSING THE SAY SOMETHING IN CHICKASAW PROJECT TO CREATE HIGH-QUALITY, MULTI-PLATFORM VIRTUAL LANGUAGE LEARNING PRODUCTS AND FUND A NETWORK OF ONLINE COMMUNITY LANGUAGE CLASSES, BOTH OF WHICH WILL EXPAND ONLINE LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION EFFORTS. THE SAY SOMETHING IN CHICKASAW PROJECT WILL ALSO EXPAND THE DIGITAL LANGUAGE ARCHIVE TO HOUSE ALL POSSIBLE DIGITAL RESOURCES FOR LEARNING THE CHICKASAW LANGUAGE, INCLUDING ALL NEW PRODUCTS CREATED BY THE PROJECT. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE SAY SOMETHING IN CHICKASAW PROJECT IS TO ENGAGE CHICKASAW CITIZENS, NO MATTER THEIR LOCATION, IN LEARNING AND USING THE CHICKASAW LANGUAGE. THE CN HAS OVER 73,000 TRIBAL CITIZENS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES (U.S.) AND WORLD. CURRENTLY, THE POPULATION OF THE CHICKASAW NATIVE LANGUAGE SPEAKERS IS LESS THAN 35, WITH AN AVERAGE AGE OF 75. WITH OVER 60 PERCENT OF THE CHICKASAW POPULATION BEING CITIZENS-AT-LARGE AND LIVING OUTSIDE OF THE TREATY TERRITORY LOCATED IN SOUTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA, LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION EFFORTS MUST INCLUDE ONLINE COMMUNITIES.THIS PROJECT WILL USE PREVIOUS DOCUMENTATION OF CHICKASAW NATIVE LANGUAGE SPEAKERS CONVERSATIONS AND TRANSFORM THESE RECORDINGS INTO LEARNER-FOCUSED PRODUCTS INCLUDING MULTIMEDIA FILES, SHORT AND LONG-FORM VIDEOS, INFOGRAPHICS AND SOCIAL MEDIA LANGUAGE EDUCATION POSTS. THE NEW LEARNER PRODUCTS WILL FOCUS ON HIGH FREQUENCY CONVERSATIONAL FRAMES (E.G. EXPRESSING GREETINGS, PREFERENCES, OPINIONS, ETC.). THIS APPROACH LEANS INTO THE CHICKASAW COMMUNITY ACCEPTANCE OF VIRTUAL, COMPUTER-AIDED LANGUAGE LEARNING PRODUCTS SUCH AS ROSETTA STONE CHICKASAW, WHICH IS CURRENTLY USED BY OVER 8,000 CHICKASAW CITIZENS. THE PROJECT WILL DISSEMINATE THESE PRODUCTS IN SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS, ONLINE COMMUNITY LANGUAGE CLASSES AND STUDY GROUPS, IN-PERSON LANGUAGE CLASSES AND ITS CURRICULA AND THE EXPANDED LANGUAGE ARCHIVE THAT IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT CHICKASAWLANGUAGE.COM. THE VIRTUAL LANGUAGE PRODUCTS CREATED BY THE SAY SOMETHING IN CHICKASAW PROJECT WILL SERVE MANY LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION PURPOSES FOR THE CHICKASAW LANGUAGE THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS, SUCH AS TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, FACEBOOK AND CHICKASAW.TV. CHICKASAW CITIZENS WILL BE ABLE TO ENGAGE WITH THE PRODUCTS TO QUICKLY LEARN PHRASES IN THE LANGUAGE AND USE THEM ONLINE WITH OTHER CHICKASAW CITIZENS. IN THE ONLINE LANGUAGE CLASSES STUDENTS WILL PRACTICE USING THE LANGUAGE FROM THE LEARNER PRODUCTS. THE CONTENT OF THE LEARNER PRODUCTS WILL COMPLEMENT EXISTING CURRICULA SO THAT PROGRAMS AND TEACHERS CAN INCORPORATE IT INTO THEIR CLASSES. WHILE ACCESSING THE ONLINE LANGUAGE ARCHIVE, USERS WILL BE CONNECTED WITH OTHER RESOURCES TO FURTHER THEIR LEARNING OF THE CHICKASAW LANGUAGE. THIS NOVEL APPROACH TO LANGUAGE DOCUMENTATION, PEDAGOGY, PRODUCT DESIGN AND DISSEMINATION WILL GREATLY ENHANCE LEARNER EXPERIENCES AND ENGAGE A LARGE PERCENTAGE OF CHICKASAW CITIZENS. IF AWARDED, THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO CONTRACT A DIGITAL MEDIA PRODUCTION COMPANY, PROVIDE CONTRACTS, TEACHING SUPPLIES AND STIPENDS FOR ONLINE COMMUNITY CLASS TEACHERS AND FUND THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPANDING THE DIGITAL LANGUAGE ARCHIVE.

PROJECT GOAL: THE AHTNA CEDAHWDEDIIXEN (INSTRUCTOR) DEVELOPMENT PROJECT CREATED BY CHICKALOON VILLAGE TRADITIONAL COUNCIL (CVTC), THE GOVERNING BODY OF CNV, PROPOSES TO SHARE AND PRESERVE THE IMPERILED AHTNA LANGUAGE THROUGH THE CREATION OF NEW AHTNA LANGUAGE RECORDINGS AND INSTRUCTOR IMMERSION TRAINING MATERIALS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH AHTNA ELDERS AND CULTURE BEARERS. OBJECTIVE #1: INCLUDES EVALUATING AND IDENTIFYING INADEQUACIES AND NEEDED ENHANCEMENTS TO THE EXISTING CURRICULUM RESOURCES AND TEACHING MODALITIES CURRENTLY USED FOR IMMERSION INSTRUCTION AT THE YA NE DAH AH SCHOOL.OBJECTIVE # 2:  INCLUDES WORKING WITH THE FEW REMAINING IDENTIFIED AHTNA LANGUAGE SPEAKING ELDERS TO CREATE NEW AHTNA LANGUAGE RECORDINGS AND TO REVIEW MATERIALS DEVELOPED IN THE CREATION OF AN IMMERSION COMPANION INSTRUCTIONAL GUIDE FOR USE IN THE YA NE DAH AH CLASSROOM, AND FOR SHARING WITH NEW AHTNA LANGUAGE PROGRAMS AND LANGUAGE PRESERVATION PARTNERS.DELIVERABLE PRODUCTS: BY THE END OF THE PROJECT, AT LEAST 100 NEW AHTNA PHRASES WILL HAVE BEEN RECORDED AND A NEW IMMERSION INSTRUCTIONAL GUIDE WILL HAVE BEEN PRODUCED AND PRINTED FOR SHARING WITH YA NE DAH AH SCHOOL TEACHERS AND WITH OTHER LANGUAGE PRESERVATION PARTNERS.

CENTRAL COUNCIL OF TLINGIT & HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA PROPOSES THE KOO AT LATOWUX HAS NAXSATEE, LET THEM BE TEACHERS, PROJECT. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE LINGT LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY OF TEN LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS WHO CURRENTLY TEACH THE LANGUAGE TO TRIBAL YOUTH AND COMMUNITIES. THE PROJECTS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY THESE LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS PARTICIPATING IN 12 MONTHLY LINGT LANGUAGE INTENSIVES AND ONE TEN (10) DAY LINGT LANGUAGE INTENSIVE RECEIVING A TOTAL OF 116 HOURS OF LINGT IMMERSION. THE GOAL OF INCREASING THE PROFICIENCY OF LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH ONE MAIN OBJECTIVE. OBJECTIVE 1) CREATE A CO-HORT OF TEN (10) LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS TO FOCUS ON AND SUPPORT EACH OTHER IN INCREASING THEIR LINGT LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY INCLUDING INSTRUCTORS FROM HAA YOO XATNGI KDI AND OTHER JUNEAU BASED LINGT LANGUAGE PROGRAMS SUCH AS THE TLINGIT CULTURE LANGUAGE & LITERACY PROGRAM, UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA SOUTHEAST STAFF INSTRUCTORS, AND LINGT LANGUAGE LEARNERS ACTIVELY PURSUING AND PARTICIPATING IN BECOMING LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS.  ACTIVITY 1) COHORT WILL MEET MONTHLY FOR THREE (3) HOURS MONTHLY OR THIRTY-SIX (36) HOURS ANNUALLY, TO ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON INCREASING THEIR LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY AND ABILITY TO TEACH THE LANGUAGE TO THEIR STUDENTS.  ACTIVITY 2) COHORT WILL CONVENE DURING A TEN (10) DAY LANGUAGE INTENSIVE PROVIDING APPROXIMATELY EIGHTY (80) HOURS OF LANGUAGE IMMERSION FOR THIRTY (30) LINGT LANGUAGE TEACHERS, ASPIRING TEACHERS, AND ELDER, BIRTH SPEAKERS.

LLGP ABSTRACT BOIS FORTE LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION PROJECTTHE TRIBE IS IN DANGER OF LOSING THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE HAVING FEW TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO CAN SPEAK FLUENTLY. THE TRIBE ESTIMATES HAVING 6 ELDERS LEFT WHO ARE FLUENT AND CAN SPEAK WITH THE DIALECT UNIQUE TO BOIS FORTE. ONE ELDER STATE THAT WHEN WE ARE PASSED ON, OUR LANGUAGE WILL BE GONE. WE ARE AT A CRITICAL STAGE WHEN THE TRIBE MUST ACT QUICK TO PRESERVE THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE. IN RESPONSE TO THE NOTICE OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITY FROM THE SECRETARY OF INTERIOR, DIVISION OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (DED) LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROJECT (LLGP), THE BOIS FORTE BAND OF CHIPPEWA HAS APPLIED FOR A LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION PROJECT.THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO MEET THE GOALS OF COLLECTING AND PRESERVING TRIBAL ELDERS SPEAKING THE LANGUAGE TO PRESERVE THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE WITH THEIR UNIQUE DIALECT. IN ADDITION, FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE DEVELOPMENT OF A LONG-RANGE STRATEGIC PLAN THAT WILL FORMULATE STRATEGY TO ACHIEVE THE REVITALIZATION OF THE OJIBWE LANGUAGE. THIS PLANNING EFFORT WILL BRING KEY STAKEHOLDERS WITH INPUT FROM THE COMMUNITY TO GATHER IN A UNITED FRONT TO DEVELOP A PLAN. THE STRATEGIC PLAN IS A VALUABLE TOOL THAT PROVIDES STRUCTURE TO MAKE DECISIONS THAT FOLLOW A LARGER VISION AND CREATES A DIRECTION FOR OUR PROJECT TO MAXIMIZE THE OUTCOME. TRIBAL MEMBERS WILL BE KEPT INFORMED ON PROJECT OUTCOMES AND ACHIEVEMENTS THROUGH TRIBAL RESOURCES. THE TRIBE FINDS THAT THE SUBMISSION OF AN LLGP GRANT APPLICATION IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF TRIBAL MEMBERS TO REVITALIZE CULTURE AND LANGUAGE WHICH IS CENTRAL TO THE CULTURAL IDENTITY, HEALTH, AND WELFARE OF TRIBAL MEMBERS.

PROJECT SUMMARY  ARCTIC SLOPE COMMUNITY, INC , SANCTIONED BY THE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OF THE VILLAGE OF WAINWRIGHT TRIBAL COUNCIL, WILL DEVELOP AN IUPIAT LANGUAGE WEB DICTIONARY, SENTENCE BUILDER, AND TRANSLATOR  THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO PRESERVE THE IUPIAT LANGUAGE IN BOTH TEXT AND SPEECH, FOR USE BY IUPIAT SPEAKERS, LEARNERS, RESEARCHERS, AND EDUCATORS, INDEFINITELY  WEBSITE CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE SEVERAL KEY FEATURES NEEDED FOR EFFECTIVE FUNCTIONALITY  1   DEVELOPMENT OF THE SENTENCE LEVEL IUPIAT WORD BUILDER, 2   COMBINING SEARCHABLE NOUNS WITH VERB AGREEMENT, 3   INCORPORATE ALL THE VERB AND NOUN MOODS FROM IUPIAT GRAMMAR BOOKS, 4   INCLUDE SEARCHABLE POST BASE ENTRIES AND EXAMPLE SENTENCES, 5   WORK WITH IUPIAT TRANSLATORS TO DEVELOP TEXT TO SPEECH OPTIONS, AND 6   PROTOTYPE WITH IUPIAT SPEAKING COMMUNITY MEMBERS

THE MANZANITA BAND OF DIEGUENO MISSION INDIANS IS UNDERTAKING THE MANZANITA FY2022 LIVING LANGUAGES PROJECT TO ADDRESS THE IMMINENT THREAT TO THE SURVIVAL OF THE KUMEYAAY LANGUAGE ON THE MANZANITA RESERVATION BY REVITALIZING THE LANGUAGES THAT CAN BE USED BY A CHILD-BEARING GENERATION, BUT CURRENTLY ARE NOT BEING TRANSMITTED TO CHILDREN. THE PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE MANZANITA TRIBAL COMMUNITY TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING COMMUNITY LANGUAGE GOALS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO BUILD THE CAPACITY TO REVITALIZE AND PRESERVE THE LANGUAGE AS IT IS SPOKEN AT MANZANITA: (1) DOCUMENT THE KUMEYAAY LANGUAGE AS IT IS SPOKEN AT MANZANITA; (2) DEVELOP OUTREACH MATERIALS TO ENABLE THE CHILDREN AND ADULTS TO LEARN TO SPEAK THE KUMEYAAY LANGUAGE; AND (3) TEACH, ASSIST, AND ENCOURAGE THE PEOPLE TO USE THE KUMEYAAY LANGUAGE IN FACE-TO-FACE COMMUNICATION AT HOME AND IN PUBLIC GATHERINGS.ALL MANZANITA TRIBAL MEMBERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROCESS, WHICH WILL BUILD THE CAPACITY TO PRESERVE THE KUMEYAAY LANGUAGE AS IT IS SPOKEN AT MANZANITA AND INCREASE THE ABILITY OF THE CHILDREN TO GRASP AND HOLD ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS OF THEIR CULTURE. THEREBY ENSURING ITS CONTINUATION, RESILIENCY, AND SURVIVAL.

THE LUSHOOTSEED CREATION HISTORY SIGNAGE PROJECT WILL FEATURE ILLUSTRATIONS AND AUDIO OF HOW DUKIB THE CHANGER TRANSFORMED EVERYTHING AND EVERYONE TO PREPARE THE WORLD FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS THROUGH SIGNAGE. THE SIGNAGE WILL BE IN THE TRADITIONAL LANGUAGE OF THE PUYALLUP TRIBE OF INDIANS, LUSHOOTSEED, AND WILL FOLLOW A DRIVING AND WALKING TOUR OF RENAMED STREET SIGNS IN THE TRIBAL RESERVATION COMMUNITY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF PEOPLE WHO SPEAK LUSHOOTSEED IN THEIR COMMUNITY, THE AMOUNT OF TIME THEY SPEAK LUSHOOTSEED DAILY, AND TO INCREASE THE VARIETY OF TOPICS THEY CAN SPEAK ABOUT. THE SECOND OBJECTIVE IS THAT INDIVIDUALS WILL LEARN PUYALLUP TRIBAL CREATION HISTORY THROUGH THE LENS OF LUSHOOTSEED, RATHER THAN ENGLISH ONLY. THIS IS PART OF A LARGER VISIBILITY CAMPAIGN TO SHARE THEIR CULTURE AND ARTWORK WITH THE WIDER COMMUNITY, SO THAT THE COMMUNITY KNOW THEY ARE ON THE LANDS OF THE PUYALLUP TRIBAL RESERVATION AND THAT THE PEOPLE OF THE PUYALLUP TRIBE FEEL PROUD SEEING THEMSELVES REPRESENTED.

IN RESPONSE TO THE NEED FOR ADVANCEMENT OF SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO KEWA KERES LANGUAGE PRESERVATION, THE KEWA KERES LIVING LANGUAGE PROJECT WILL SUPPLEMENT AND BUILD ON THE PUEBLOS ONGOING LANGUAGE ACQUISITION AND EXTENSION PROGRAMMING TO DELIVER INTERGENERATIONALLY-INFORMED, CULTURALLY-WHOLISTIC, AND PANDEMIC-RESPONSIVE LANGUAGE CLASSES AND ACTIVITIES TO EIGHT-HUNDRED STUDENTS ATTENDING SEVEN TRIBALLY-APPROVED KEWA KERES LANGUAGE LEARNING SITES AND EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS. THE PROJECT WILL EMPLOY A FULL-TIME PROJECT COORDINATOR TO OVERSEE THE PROJECT AND FIVE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO COMMUNITY ELDER INSTRUCTORS EACH DELIVERING FIVE LANGUAGE CLASSES AT THE SEVEN SCHOOL SITES OVER AN EIGHT-MONTH PERIOD. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE INITIAL ORIENTATION OF THE PROJECT COORDINATOR AND TRIBAL ELDER INSTRUCTORS BY THE KEWA KERES LANGUAGE PROGRAM MANAGER. THE KEWA KERES LANGUAGE PROGRAM MANAGER, PROJECT COORDINATOR, NEW MEXICO CERTIFIED AND TRIBALLY-ENDORSED SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO KERES TEACHERS, AND TRIBAL ELDER INSTRUCTORS WILL COLLABORATE ON THE IDENTIFICATION OF QUARTERLY PROGRAM GOALS AND CLASSROOM ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECT COORDINATOR WILL CONDUCT A PRE, INTERIM, AND POST ASSESSMENT TO TRACK PROGRESS ACCORDING TO EACH QUARTERS GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OVER THE COURSE OF THE ONE-YEAR PERFORMANCE PERIOD. FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR STAFF SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS, INSTRUCTOR STIPENDS AND TRANSPORTATION, EQUIPMENT, MATERIALS, SUPPLIES, FOOD, AND TRAVEL FOR REQUIRED 3-DAY GRANTEE MEETING IN WASHINGTON, DC. THIS PROJECTS OBJECTIVES AND GOALS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO SHORT-TERM AND LONG-TERM LANGUAGE, HISTORIC, AND CULTURAL PRESERVATION GOALS OF SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO IN 1) CONTINUING TO DIRECTLY MINIMIZE INTERGENERATIONAL LANGUAGE-USE DISRUPTION; 2) MAINTAIN AND BUILD ON THE INTERGENERATIONAL LEARNING COMPONENT OF KEWA KERES LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION; 3) ADVANCE HOLISTIC SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO CULTURAL LANGUAGE LEARNING; AND 4) ADDRESS THE GAP IN CLASSROOM KEWA KERES LANGUAGE LEARNING RESULTING FROM THE ONGOING CORONAVIRUS NATIONAL HEALTH EMERGENCY.

THE WASHOE TRIBE OF NEVADA AND CALIFORNIA (WTNC) THROUGH THE CULTURE/LANGUAGE RESOURCES DEPARTMENT (CRD) REQUESTS LIVING LANGUAGES GRANT PROGRAM FUNDING BEING ADMINISTERED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR  BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS TO IMPLEMENT THE WASHOE TRIBE MASTER-APPRENTICE PROGRAM PROJECT.  THIS PROJECT IS FOCUSED ON THE PRESERVATION, DOCUMENTATION AND REVITALIZATION OF THE WASHOE LANGUAGE THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A WASHOE TRIBE MASTER-APPRENTICE PROGRAM. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE NEW CONVERSATIONALLY FLUENT SPEAKERS OF THE WASHOE LANGUAGE AT THE INTERMEDIATE TO EXPERT LEVEL AMONGST YOUNGER GENERATIONS WITHIN THE WTNC WHO CAN USE THE LANGUAGE TO COMMUNICATE IN DAILY LIFE, ACADEMIC SETTINGS SUCH AS CLASSROOMS AND WITH CHILDREN/FAMILIES IN THE HOME.

THROUGH THE WICHITA COMMUNITY LANGUAGE PROJECT, THE WICHITA AND AFFILIATED TRIBES OF OKLAHOMA AND THE WICHITA CULTURAL EDUCATION PROGRAM AIM TO ESTABLISH A FIVE-YEAR WICHITA LANGUAGE REAWAKENING PLAN FOR ITS APPROXIMATELY 3,500 ENROLLED MEMBERS AND DEVELOP FOUNDATIONAL WICHITA LANGUAGE CURRICULAR MATERIALS TO SUPPORT LANGUAGE PROGRAMMING. THIS PROJECT BUILDS ON THE WICHITA LANGUAGE ARCHIVES, THE LASTING LEGACY OF WICHITAS LAST HERITAGE SPEAKER, DORIS LAMAR-MCLEMORE, WHO CONDUCTED MANY LANGUAGE PRESERVATION AND DOCUMENTATION EFFORTS BEFORE HER PASSING IN 2016. THE WICHITA LANGUAGE LIVES ON THROUGH THESE ARCHIVES, AND THEY WILL SERVE AS THE FOUNDATION FOR EFFORTS TO CREATE NEW GENERATIONS OF FLUENT SPEAKERS. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A COMMUNITY-DRIVEN PLAN FOR BUILDING LANGUAGE-LEARNING RESOURCES AND PROGRAMMING FROM THESE ARCHIVES WITH THE LONG-TERM COMMUNITY GOAL OF CREATING NEW GENERATIONS OF FLUENT WICHITA SPEAKERS. BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, IT WILL DELIVER (1) SIX COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS ON THE WICHITA LANGUAGE; (2) A CATALOGUED WICHITA DICTIONARY DATABASE; (3) ELDER RECORDINGS OF TRADITIONAL SONGS AND STORIES; (4) A WICHITA LANGUAGE CODE; AND (5) A FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR LANGUAGE PROGRAMMING USING THESE NEW RESOURCES AS A FOUNDATION FOR LONG-TERM LANGUAGE REVITALIZATION EFFORTS. THESE DELIVERABLES WILL ENSURE COMMUNITY INVESTMENT IN LANGUAGE REAWAKENING AND HELP ESTABLISH COMMUNITY-DETERMINED NORMS FOR WRITING, READING, AND SPEAKING THE LANGUAGE. THEY WILL ALSO PROVIDE UP-TO-DATE, ACCESSIBLE, AND USER-FRIENDLY LANGUAGE REFERENCE MATERIALS FROM WHICH THE WICHITA CULTURAL/LANGUAGE PROGRAM WILL GENERATE CURRICULUM AND DEVELOP FUTURE LANGUAGE-LEARNING RESOURCES FOR STUDENTS WITH ALL LEVELS OF WICHITA LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY. OVER THE COURSE OF THE YEAR, THE WICHITA AND AFFILIATED TRIBES WILL HOLD SIX (6) BIMONTHLY COMMUNITY LANGUAGE WORKSHOPS TO GATHER COMMUNITY INPUT AND EXISTING KNOWLEDGE OF THE WICHITA LANGUAGE AND LANGUAGE EDUCATION. THESE MEETINGS WILL COVER A VARIETY OF TOPICS PERTAINING TO LINGUISTICS, LANGUAGE REAWAKENING, AND STRATEGIES FOR LANGUAGE EDUCATION. THROUGH THESE WORKSHOPS, COMMUNITY LEADERS AND MEMBERS WILL DETERMINE COMMUNITY PRIORITIES FOR LANGUAGE DOCUMENTATION AND REVITALIZATION AND MAP A COURSE FOR THE EARLY DEVELOPMENT OF THE WICHITA CULTURAL/LANGUAGE PROGRAM. ONCE A WICHITA LANGUAGE ORTHOGRAPHY HAS BEEN SELECTED FOR ALL PRESENT AND FUTURE LANGUAGE DOCUMENTATION PROJECTS, THE CULTURAL/LANGUAGE PROGRAM WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE LANGUAGE CONSERVANCY (TLC) TO CATALOG THE EXISTING WICHITA LANGUAGE DICTIONARY DATABASE AND UPLOAD EACH ENTRY INTO A TLEX DATABASE. THIS DATABASE WILL SERVE AS THE CORNERSTONE FOR CREATING FUTURE LANGUAGE-LEARNING RESOURCES, INCLUDING A COMPREHENSIVE DICTIONARY AND SCAFFOLDED CURRICULUM. THE ESTABLISHED FIVE-YEAR PLAN WILL ENSURE A PATHWAY TO REALIZING THE COMMUNITY GOALS OF WICHITA LANGUAGE REAWAKENING THROUGH RESOURCES, PROGRAMMING, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. NEW RECORDINGS OF ELDER SPEAKERS WILL ALSO BE CREATED TO PRESERVE TRADITIONAL SONGS AND STORIES.

THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE OF NEBRASKA IS REQUESTING $81,134 IN BIA LIVING LANGUAGE GRANT PROGRAM (LLGP) FUNDS TO SUPPORT PHASE II OF THE MULTI-PHASE HCK GRAMMAR RESEARCH AND VIDEO PROJECT.  THE GOAL OF THIS MULTI-PHASE PROJECT IS TO DOCUMENT AND PRESERVE THE KNOWLEDGE OF TRIBAL ELDERS AND SPEAKERS OF HCK (THE HOCHUNK LANGUAGE), IN ORDER TO REVITALIZE HOCHUNK LANGUAGE USAGE THROUGHOUT THE WINNEBAGO COMMUNITY AND AMONG FUTURE GENERATIONS.  THIS MULTI-PHASE PROJECT SEEKS TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL THROUGH THE PRODUCTION OF GRAMMAR VIDEOS, WHICH ASSIST LEARNERS GROWTH AS LANGUAGE USERS BY OFFERING A FRAMEWORK WITH WHICH TO EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE, ALONG WITH INTERACTIVE ACTIVITIES TO PRACTICE NEW GRAMMATICAL CONCEPTS.  SIX (6) NOVICE-MID LEVEL GRAMMAR TOPICS WILL BE CHOSEN THROUGH THE PROCESS OF COMMUNITY SURVEY. CONVERSATIONS BETWEEN ELDER HOCHUNK SPEAKERS ON CHOSEN TOPICS WILL BE FILMED TO CAPTURE AUTHENTIC SPEECH EXAMPLES OF HOCHUNK LANGUAGE USAGE.  THE AUDIO AND VIDEO FROM RECORDED CONVERSATIONS WILL BE USED TO PRODUCE SIX (6) NEW GRAMMAR VIDEOS, AS WELL AS TEN (10) TOPIC-SPECIFIC AUDIO RECORDINGS OF AUTHENTIC SPEECH, ALL AT THE NOVICE-MID LANGUAGE LEARNING LEVEL.  VIDEOS WILL BE PRODUCED WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF WINNEBAGO STUDENTS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND HOCHUNK RENAISSANCE LANGUAGE PROGRAM STAFF, WHO WILL ACT OUT EXAMPLES FROM FILMED CONVERSATIONS.  ONCE THE PRODUCED FILM SERIES AND RECORDED EXAMPLES OF AUTHENTIC SPEECH ARE FINALIZED, A PUBLIC PRESENTATION WILL BE MADE TO INTRODUCE THE FILMS AND RECORDINGS, AND SHOWCASE SAMPLES OF THE COMPLETED WORK.  COMPLETED VIDEOS AND RECORDINGS WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO HOCHUNK RENAISSANCE PROGRAM CLASSES, AND WILL ALSO BE FREE AND EASILY ACCESSIBLE AS LANGUAGE LEARNING RESOURCES THROUGH YOUTUBE, FACEBOOK, THE NEW HOCHUNK RENAISSANCE WEBSITE, AS WELL AS FUTURE AUDIO BROADCASTS ON THE TRIBES KWTN RADIO STATION.

THE HAROUKLHAMUN (WHAT IS WATCHED) PROJECT WILL CREATE 20 SHORT (3-10 MINUTE) VIDEOS STRUCTURED AROUND SHORT CONVERSATIONS IN SOULATLUK (THE WIYOT LANGUAGE) TO BE USED AS MINI-LESSONS FOR HOME STUDY. THESE VIDEOS WILL BE AN IMPORTANT TOOL FOR THE WIYOT TRIBES ONGOING EFFORTS TO RECOVER SOULATLUK (WHOSE LAST FLUENT SPEAKERS DIED OVER 60 YEARS AGO) FROM ARCHIVAL RECORDS. DR. LYNNIKA BUTLER, LINGUIST FOR THE WIYOT TRIBE, WILL SERVE AS PROJECT MANAGER, AND WIYOT TRIBAL MEMBER AND CULTURAL CENTER MANAGER MARNIE ATKINS WILL ADVISE THE PROJECT ON PEDAGOGICAL EFFECTIVENESS. WE WILL CONTRACT WITH MICHELLE HERNANDEZ, AN EXPERIENCED FILMMAKER AND WIYOT TRIBAL MEMBER, TO PROVIDE VIDEO SHOOTING AND EDITING TRAINING TO PROJECT STAFF AND INTERESTED TRIBAL MEMBERS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PROJECT, AS WELL AS ONGOING LONG-DISTANCE CONSULTATION THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT. PROJECT OBJECTIVES/GOALS1.TO ESTABLISH A VIDEO LIBRARY OF SOULATLUK LEARNING CONTENT WHICH CAN BE EXPANDED IN FUTURE YEARS ACCORDING TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITYS LANGUAGE LEARNING PROGRESS AND NEEDS.2.TO TRAIN WIYOT TRIBE STAFF AND INTERESTED TRIBAL MEMBERS IN BASIC VIDEO FILMING AND EDITING TECHNIQUES TO INCREASE THE TRIBES CAPACITY TO GENERATE FUTURE VIDEO CONTENT.3.TO MAKE SOULATLUK MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THE ENTIRE WIYOT TRIBAL COMMUNITY (ENROLLED MEMBERS AS WELL AS THOSE WITH WIYOT ANCESTRY BUT NO FORMAL MEMBERSHIP).4.TO INCREASE WIYOT TRIBAL MEMBERS INTEREST IN SOULATLUK.LANGUAGE CONTENT FOR PROJECT VIDEOS WILL PRIMARILY CONSIST OF SHORT SOULATLUK CONVERSATIONS RESEARCHED AND COMPILED AS PART OF AN INSTITUTE OF MUSEUM AND LIBRARY SERVICES (IMLS)-FUNDED SOULATLUK CONVERSATION BOOK WHICH IS CURRENTLY IN THE EDITING STAGE AND WILL BE COMPLETED THIS SUMMER. WE AIM TO RECRUIT MEMBERS OF THE WIYOT TRIBAL COMMUNITY TO SHOOT AND EDIT AT LEAST 5 OF THE VIDEOS FOR THIS PROJECT, WITH PROJECT STAFF PROVIDING PRONUNCIATION COACHING BEFORE AND DURING FILMING; THE REMAINING VIDEOS WILL BE FILMED AND EDITED BY PROJECT STAFF.
